docs.text: All the information for the districts are pre-saved and appears in the field. As you click on the field, you can edit based on the following circumstances If a district (State or City) to be edited has a DM assigned to a building in the current district State and City fields are grey- out and disable. when State or City fields are clicked, have a popup message appear "Cannot Edit District. A DM is assigned to a building." DM cannot be unchecked (unassigned) from a district if he is assigned to a building in the current district. DM field is Grey- out and disable check-mark When check-mark is clicked, have popup message appear. "Cannot unassigned DM. DM is assigned to a building in this District." Update button remains disable until a information has been edited " The update button remains enabled even when no changes have been made, clicking on the update office button, will redirect you to qhl office listing with a success notification.
docs.title: Edit Districts

docs.text: You can view the landing page in two views; list view & calendar view. When there are no schedules(current and upcoming) active in a month including, the information on landing shows no records for both kind of view as seen in the image As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page. For showing the total customers, employees and buildings on the admin portal through three cards. Section is divided into today, next week and remaining months schedules (which include the next three week) Table for each section include the same columns as follows Work date - The day on which the work to be performed for the schedule Building Name - For whom the work is scheduled for Shift - Building's shift Department - Buildings' department Container Type - Type and quantity of containers scheduled Total Containers - Total quantity of containers scheduled Created by - Name of the person who created either customer's contact(managers & supervisors) or lead for the building appears Status - Various types of following status appears for the scheduled Scheduled - When the schedule has been created and work has not started. Color code is light blue Signed - When customer signs customer sheet, it depicts the work has been completed. Color code is dark blue Overdue- When the scheduled work shift and customer has not signed the customer sheet. Color code is orange. In Progress - When lumpers starts to work on the first scheduled container. Completed - When all schedules are in complete status Cancelled - When not all containers are given a complete status Terminated - When a schedule has been cancelled by the contact or lead Unfinished - Has a container that has to be resumed in future Action Live Details - As you click on the red network button, you'll be redirected to page where you can view live updates for the current day of a schedule Schedule Details - As you click on the eye button, you'll be redirected to the schedules details page Calendar View Total containers for a building are visible for each day with a combination of all shifts & departments. When you click on the card for a following, pop up appears with the scheduled information Can switch between month to see the future schedules
docs.title: Landing Page

docs.text: Live details of the schedule as the container status's keep on updating Appears for only the current active day of the schedule A informative section of the building appears on top which consists of the building name, address, Manager & supervisor's name, work date, shift and it's time, department, main lead with the work schedule status A section appears for the container status, how many are scheduled and the count under each status For each container type; a separate section is presented followed by it's detail. The hierarchy followed for this is Outbound, live load and drop The column in the table is as followed Scheduled - The status of the container Fixed container parameters appears which are followed in the listed hierarchy Door, Container Number, Cases, Items/Sort After The fixed containers, additional or customer parameters if any will appear in the columns Worker - Who all worked on the container Start Time - Of the schedule End Time - of the schedule Status - of the container Scheduled Notes If there any notes associated, the button will turn blue and if not then grey As you click on the pop up, the saved note appears. The pop up includes the notes for customer and QHL entered by the lead.
docs.title: Work progress

docs.text: You can view the landing page in two views; list view & calendar view. When there are no schedules(current and upcoming) active in a month shows no records for both kind of view as seen in the image. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page. Search - A single search bar which throws result for the below two functions. Placeholder for the search bar is "Search Building Name" with a search icon. All Buildings As you type the respective associated information regarding the entered building name will start appearing in the table. Search function overwrites the filters. Widgets Shift - Can select the shifts from the dropdown Created By - Name of the person who has created the schedule appears in the dropdown Status - Can filter via status All Dates - Can search via specific schedule through their work date Table for each section include the same columns as follows Building Name - For whom the work is scheduled for Shift - Building's shift Duration - The duration, custom, weekly or monthly, represented in a date form Total Days - The total for which the schedule is created for Container Type / Duration - Type and quantity of containers scheduled Total Containers / Duration - Total quantity of containers scheduled Created by - Name of the person who created either customer's contact(managers & supervisors) or lead for the building appears Status - Various types of following status appears for the scheduled Scheduled - When the schedule has been created and work has not started. Color code is light blue Signed - When customer signs customer sheet, it depicts the work has been completed. Color code is dark blue Overdue- When the scheduled work shift and customer has not signed the customer sheet. Color code is orange. In Progress - When lumpers starts to work on the first scheduled container. Action Notes - As you click on the button, a pop up open to view the details of the scheduled notes Schedule Details - As you click on the eye button, you'll be redirected to the schedules details page A schedule automatically moves to non active after the work date has been passed or terminated Calendar View total containers for a building are visible for each day with a combination of all shifts & departments. When you click on the card for a following, pop up appears with the scheduled information Can switch between month to see the future schedules
docs.title: Landing Page

docs.text: Appears for only the upcoming schedules in a month. Can view the landing page in two views. View by Date and by type. As suggested by the name the filtering on the page would be done through upcoming days for the schedule for the former type. for the later type the filtering would eb done based on the container type. A informative section of the building appears which consists of the building name, address,Manager & supervisor's name, work date, shift and it's time, department, main lead, total scheduled containers with the status For each container type; a separate section is presented followed by it's detail. The hierarchy followed for this is Outbound The column in the table is as followed Origin - The status of the container Start Time - Of the schedule Scheduled On - the date it was scheduled Duration - Based on custom, weekly or monthly Created By - By whom it was created Role - Role of the person who created Status - Status of the container Scheduled Notes If there any notes associated, the button will turn blue and if not then grey As you click on the pop up, the saved note appears.
docs.title: Schedule Detail Page

docs.text: As the assigned employee (lead & lumper) clocks into the portal to start work on the schedule, their attendance appears in this section. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page. A report button appears on the top which will redirect you to report item selection page. Search All Buildings Placeholder for the search bar is "All Buildings". As you type the respective associated name will start appearing the dropdown. Based on the filters selected, data will be populated for them Employees Placeholder for the search bar is "Search by Lumper name" with a search icon. Based on the filter selected, the data will be only populated for them. All Dates - Can search via specific schedule through their work date Widgets Shift - All departments appear in the dropdown Department - All departments appear in the dropdown Clocked Out - Two status appears in the dropdown for the employee if he has clocked out or not Signature - If the customer sheet has been signed, based on it two status appears which are signed and pending Landing Page - Table for each section include the same columns as follows Date - The day the person has logged into the portal through mobile application Building - Name of the building for whom the work is scheduled for Name - Name of the employee for which the attendance is clocked in for Role - The role of the clocked in employee Shift - The abbreviation for the shifts Department - The abbreviation for the department Clocked In - When he clocks into the portal Clocked Out - When he clocks out of the portal Total time - calculated between the clock in & clock out time Lunch Start - Time when lunch break started Lunch end - Time when lunch break was end Total Lunch - calculated between the lunch start & lunch end time Reg Time Work Time OT DOT Signature Pending - When the customer hasn't signed the sheet Signed - When the customer has signed the sheet Note - If the notes were saved while adding the attendance will appear in and the button will turn blue or else grey
docs.title: Time Clock

docs.text: When there are no customer sheet submitted by lead for a building's schedule. The information in table appears as blank with no records as seen in the image. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing customer sheet report or generate it. Report Button - Appears on right side which redirects the user for generating the report Search - search bars which throws result for the below two functions. All Buildings As you type the respective associated information regarding the entered building name will start appearing in the dropdown. If no data is available then no records will be shown Search function overwrites the filters. Search Customer As you type the respective associated information regarding the entered building name will start appearing in the dropdown. If no data is available then no records will be shown Search function overwrites the filters. Search Customer, Building, Representative or QHL Lead Search through the name of lead and lumpers that are temporarily scheduled, results will start populating in the table By representative it will search that lead has saved when signing up for customer details to submit a customer sheet If no information is available, then no records will be shown All Dates - Can search via specific schedule through their work date Widgets Shift - Can select the shifts from the dropdown Department - can select departments from the dropdown Signature Signed - Signed customer sheet when signed and submitted by lead Pending - Pending customer sheet The table consists of following columns: Date - The customer sheet was signed Customer - Associated customer name appears for the respective building's schedule Building - Associated building name appears for the schedule Shift - Building's shift appears Department - Building's department appears Lead - Assigned main lead name appears Not Completed - Counter of the containers appears which are in not completed status. If no containers have not completed status then 0 appears Cancelled - Counter of the containers appears which are in cancelled status. If no containers have not cancelled status then 0 appears Completed - Counter of the containers appears which are in completed status. If no containers have completed status then 0 appears Signature Status of signed or pending appears When clicked on the signed button, opens pop up to show the representative name & signature Action Note When notes are saved while submitting the sheet. Button turn blue and when clicked upon opens a pop up to show the saved note If no notes are saved, button turns grey and is disable Eye Icon - To view customer sheet detail page
docs.title: Landing Page

docs.text: As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing customer sheet report or generate it. Report Button - Appears on right side which redirects the user for generating the report The page is divided into separate section which includes the building details with ready to export functionality and for the container type details The first section - Building details consists of Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button Generate button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report Building details which includes Building Name - with the complete address Work date - Complete day of work with the day, month date, year. Does not consists of abbreviations for months Customer Name Shift - Shift of the building Representative Name - the name lead fills up while submitting the customer sheet Manager - Name of the manager Shift Time - When we create a building, the time for the shift appears Signature - Uploaded signature will appear when lead submitted the customer sheet Supervisor - Name of the supervisor Department - full name of the department appears Representative Notes - Which were entered while submitting the customer sheet Lead - Name of the lead appears Not completed - Counter of the Unfinished & not open containers which comes under this status. Cancelled - Counter of the container which comes under this status Completed - Counter of the container which comes under this status The next section include container type with following hierarchy outbound, live load, drop with total count on each section if available. The following column appear for the container type Origin - by whom it was added Fixed container parameters appears which are followed in the listed hierarchy Door, Container Number, Cases, Items/Sort After The fixed containers, additional or customer parameters if any will appear in the columns Status Cancelled - When the container has been moved to cancel state. Can move before or after the work done has been completed Completed - When the container has been moved to complete state. All work done has to be completed Unfinished - When the container has been moved to unfinished state, has work remaining to be done. Remaining work is scheduled to be completed in upcoming days Not Open - When the container has been moved to Not open state. Can move before or after all the work done has been completed Lumper Note As you click on the button, a pop up open to view the details of the scheduled notes If there any notes associated, the button will turn blue and if not then grey For completed, only lumper note for customer will appear For Cancelled & not open, only group note will appear For unfinished, both group note & lumper note for customer will appear
docs.title: Customer Sheet Detail

docs.text: As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing customer sheet report or generate it. The page is divided into separate section which includes the selection section and the associated filtered results 1. The first includes the selection of building through the following - Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button - Generate & generate summary button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) - View button would redirect to the detail page - Buttons will be activate once you select the desired building or tab - Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report - Select customer by entering the name, related information will appear in the dropdown. select the desired from the dropdown - Select desired state & city - Select teh desired building from the dropdown. Buildings appear based on the above filters applied - Select the desired shift & departments - Select the date range (start & end) from the calendar pop up - By default, the current date appears - Start & End date cannot be same 2. As per the selected filters, information starts to appear in the next section which is again divided into two tabs. If no information is available, no records found message appears - First Tab - Select Building - All available shifts & departments will appear - The following columns appear - Customer - Name of the customer will appear - Building - building name will appear - Shift - shift name will appear - Department - department name will appear - Leads - Lead name will appear - You can either select any particular row or can select all - Second Tab - select shift / department - Can select specific shift or departments for buildings - - The following columns appear - Customer - Name of the customer will appear - Building - building name will appear - Shift - shift name will appear - Department - department name will appear - Leads - Lead name will appear - You can either select any particular row or can select all 3. Hierarchy Order for listing is as followed - Customer Name (alphabetical order) - Building Name (alphabetical order) - Shift (Day, Swing, Night) - Department (Operations, Receiving, Shipping)
docs.title: Customer Sheet Report: Item Selection

docs.text: When there are no lumpers sheet submitted by lead for a building's schedule. The information in table appears as blank with no records as seen in the image. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing lumper sheet report or generate it. Report Button - Appears on right side which redirects the user for generating the report Search - search bar which throws result for the below two functions. All Buildings As you type the respective associated information regarding the entered building name will start appearing in the table. If no data is available then no records will be shown Search function overwrites the filters. Search by Customer, Building, QHL Lead or Lumper Search through the name of lead and lumpers that are temporarily scheduled, results will start populating in the table If no information is available, then no records will be shown All Dates - Can search via specific schedule through their work date Widgets Shift - Can select the shifts from the dropdown Department - can select departments from the dropdown Hierarchy Order for listing is as followed Date (Reverse Chronological order) Customer Name (Alphabetical order) Building Name (Alphabetical order) Shift (Day, Swing, Night) Department (Operations, Receiving, Shipping) Container Hierarchy Order in listing Complete containers Unfinished containers. The table consists of following columns: Date - The lumper sheet was signed Customer - Associated customer name appears for the respective building's schedule Building - Associated building name appears for the schedule Shift - Building's shift appears Department - Building's department appears Lead - Assigned main lead name appears Not Completed - Counter of the containers appears which are in not completed status. If no containers have not completed status then 0 appears Cancelled - Counter of the containers appears which are in cancelled status. If no containers have not cancelled status then 0 appears Work Completed - Counter of the containers appears which are in completed status. If no containers have completed status then 0 appears Count only appears when customer sheet has been signed until then info appears but with 0 Worker Count of the numbers of worked who were scheduled to work on containers When clicked on the number, opens a pop up to show information of the employee( lead & lumper) who worked Action Eye Icon - To view lumper sheet detail page
docs.title: Lumper Sheet

docs.text: As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing lumper sheet report or generate it. Report Button - Appears on right side which redirects the user for generating the report The page is divided into separate section which includes the building details with ready to export functionality and for the container type details The first section - Building details consists of Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button Generate button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report Building details which includes Building Name - with the complete address Work date - Complete day of work with the day, month date, year. Does not consists of abbreviations for months Customer Name Shift - Shift of the building Shift Time - When we create a building, the time for the shift appears Manager - Name of the manager Department - full name of the department appears Supervisor - Name of the supervisor Lead - Name of the lead appears Containers Unfinished - completed - Counter of the Unfinished & not open containers which comes under this status. Containers Completed - Count of the container which comes under this status "complete" Workers - Count of workers (lead & lumper). Includes requested & temporary too The next section include container type with following hierarchy completed & unfinished with employee name(lead, lumper, requested lumper & temporary lumper), ID and Role(for temporary & requested [T] & [R] appears). The following column appears. Status - Only complete & unfinished appear Type - Type of container is stated Door - Information added by lead for entering container parameters Container - Information added by lead for entering container parameters Cases - Information added by lead for entering container parameters Items/Sort - Information added by lead for entering container parameters Additional parameters - Information added by lead for entering additional container parameters Start time - start time entered for the scheduled lumper End Time - start time entered for the scheduled lumper Total Time - total time is calculated based on the start & end time Total Pause - pause time entered for the scheduled lumpers. If lead hasn't filled then 0 appears Waiting time - waiting time entered for the scheduled lumpers. If lead hasn't filled then 0 appears Work Done If work done is less than 100%, a pop up opens which shows the details of who worked based on percentage. The info should add up to 100% Lumper Notes As you click on the button, a pop up open to view the details of the scheduled notes If there any notes associated, the button will turn blue and if not then grey For completed, only lumper note for customer will appear For unfinished, both group note & lumper note for customer will appear
docs.title: Lumper Sheet Report - View

docs.text: As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing lumper sheet report or generate it. The page is divided into separate section which includes the selection section and the associated filtered results 1. The first includes the selection of building through the following - Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button - Generate & generate summary button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) - View button would redirect to the detail page - Buttons will be activate once you select the desired row on tab - Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report - Select customer by entering the name, related information will appear in the dropdown. select the desired from the dropdown - Select desired state & city - Select the desired building from the dropdown. Buildings appear based on the above filters applied - Select the desired shift & departments - Select the date range (start & end) from the calendar pop up - By default, the current date appears - Start & End date can be same 2. As per the selected filters, information starts to appear in the next section which is again divided into three tabs. If no information is available, no records found message appears - First Tab - Select Building - All available shifts & departments will appear - The following columns appear - Customer - Name of the customer will appear - Building - building name will appear - Shift - shift name will appear - Department - department name will appear - Leads - Lead name will appear - You can either select any particular row or can select all - Second Tab - select shift / department - Can select specific shift or departments for buildings - The following columns appear - Customer - Name of the customer will appear - Building - building name will appear - Shift - shift name will appear - Department - department name will appear - Leads - Lead name will appear - You can either select any particular row or can select all - Third Tab - Select worker - Shows the employee information who have worked on the containers - The following columns appear - Name - Name of the employee will appear - Role - Lead & lumper will appear - For temporary & requested [T] & [R] appears with their role - Customer - Name of the customer will appear - Building - building name will appear - Shift - shift name will appear - Department - department name will appear - You can either select any particular row or can select all 3. Hierarchy order for listing within each column is as followed - Customer (alphabetical) - Building (alphabetical) - Shift (Day, Swing, Night) - Department (Operations, Receiving, Shipping) - Leads (alphabetical order) - Lumpers (alphabetical order) - role (lead, Lumpers) - name (alphabetical order)

docs.text: As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page for whom you can download and view the report. Work reports for the following section appears which includes their detail page and ability to generate reports when clicked Dashboard Schedules Time Clock Lumper Sheet Customer Sheet Empty Container Customers Employees

Name - Name of the employee for which the attendance is clocked in for ID - Employee Id is shown Role - The role of the clocked in employee Clocked In - When he clocks into the portal Clocked Out - When he clocks out of the portal Total time - calculated between the clock in & clock out time Lunch Start - Time when lunch break started Lunch end - Time when lunch break was end Total Lunch - calculated between the lunch start & lunch end time Reg Time Work Time OT DOT Signature Pending - When the customer hasn't signed the lumper sheet Signed - When the customer has signed the lumper sheet Note - If the notes were saved while adding the attendance will appear in and the button will turn blue or else grey If no information is there for time then -- appears Hierarchy order for listing within each column is as followed role (lead, Lumpers) name (alphabetical order)

If no information is available, no records found message appears First Tab - Active - All active customers will appear The following columns appear Customer - Name of the customer will appear Building - count of the building Managers - count of the manager Supervisor - count of the supervisor Active Since - date the customer profile is active since You can either select any particular row or can select all Second Tab - Non Active - All non active employees will appear The following columns appear Customer - Name of the customer will appear Building - count of the building Managers - count of the manager Supervisor - count of the supervisor Non Active Since - date the customer profile was made non active You can either select any particular row or can select all

If no information is available, no records found message appears First Tab - Active - All active employees will appear with the total count in header The following columns appear Name - name of the employee will appear ID - Unique ID associated with employee will appear Phone - Unique phone number associated with employee will appear Email - Unique email associated with employee will appear Role - Role of the employee appears Work Location - The address sof the building employee is assigned to appears Active Since - date the customer profile is active since You can either select any particular row or can select all Second Tab - Non Active - All non active employees will appear with the total count in header The following columns appear Name - name of the employee will appear ID - Unique ID associated with employee will appear Phone - Unique phone number associated with employee will appear Email - Unique email associated with employee will appear Role - Role of the employee appears Work Location - The address sof the building employee is assigned to appears Non Active Since - date the customer profile was made non active You can either select any particular row or can select all

docs.text: When there are no lead and lumpers scheduled as temporary for a building. The information in table appears as blank with no records as seen in the image. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as adding, cancelling or unassign a lumper Search - search bars which throws result for the below two functions. All Buildings As you type the respective associated information regarding the entered building name will start appearing in the table. If no data is available then no records will be shown Search function overwrites the filters. Search Lumper, Lead Search through the name of lead and lumpers that are temporarily scheduled, results will start populating in the table If no information is available, then no records will be shown All Dates - Can search via specific schedule through their work date Widgets Shift - Can select the shifts from the dropdown District Managers - Name of the person who has created the schedule appears in the dropdown Department - can select departments from the dropdown Two types of section are available; Scheduled and expired Schedules with the count. Schedules are the ones which are active and running for the current and upcoming days. Expired are the ones where the schedule was cancelled the work date has been passed or completed. Table for each section include the same columns as follows Temp lumpers - Name of the employee(lead & Lumper) Sent to Building - For whom the employee is scheduled for District Manager - Name of the main district manager of the scheduled building Lead- Name of the main lead of the scheduled building Shift Details - Building's shift details appear Assigned By - Name of the person who assigned Date Assigned - When the employee was added as temporary Work date - For the day, teh lumper is assigned Start Time - From when the schedule lumper will start Status - Various types of following status appears for the scheduled Scheduled - When the schedule has been created and work has not started. Only appears for the scheduled table. Cancelled - When the temporary lumper request has been cancelled by admin or DM. Completed - When the scheduled work for the temporary lumper has been completed. Action Notes - As you click on the button, a pop up open to view the details of the scheduled notes. Button would be disabled when no notes have been added and grey when there are notes Edit - Edit button to edit the schedule details fro the temporary lumpers Cancel - Blue cross button to cancel the schedule. The assigned temporary lumper (employee) will be unassigned
docs.title: Landing Page

docs.text: To add a lead or lumper on temporary basis, a pop up opens when you click on the add button. The fields are as follows: Customer Start typing the customer name, relevant names would appear in the dropdown and can select from the dropdown. Search will start appearing once you enter the first alphabet Building Respective building under the customer name wills start appearing Shift - The selected shift for the building will start appearing Department - The selected department will start appearing for the selected building Select lumpers Available lead & lumpers will start appearing proven they fulfil the criteria that they have the ability to travel selected as yes Distance to be shown, calculating them from selected employee address to selected building address; if it falls under their mentioned range of travel across buildings have them appear in the dropdown Not assigned as the main lead & lumper for the building For the same building and shift can assign the same employee Can search the employee by entering their name Work Duration - Based on custom, weekly, day or monthly Start time - Only shows the range selected for the building Notes - Enter the notes for the temporary schedule lumper Schedule button remains deactivated until all information is fulfilled, with a success notification it redirects you back to the listing page. All are mandatory field except notes
docs.title: Add Temporary Lumper

docs.text: When a lead requests for lumper, the requests appear on the web portal under lumper requests. As the new request has been made, a red count appear in the side navigating tab and a rot dot appears beside the new lumper request on it's landing page. When there are no lead and lumpers scheduled as temporary for a building. The information in table appears as blank with no records as seen in the image. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as to fulfil a request partially or fully. Search - search bars which throws result for the below two functions. All Buildings As you type the respective associated information regarding the entered building name will start appearing in the table. If no data is available then no records will be shown Search function overwrites the filters. Customer Search through the name of Customer for whom the request is generated, results will start populating in the table If no information is available, then no records will be shown Search Customer, building District manager, Lead Search through the name of Customer, building District manager and lead for whom the request is generated, results will start populating in the table If no information is available, then no records will be shown Widgets State / City - As you select a state, then the city filter gets activated and you can select - Based on the state selected, the city will be populated - Based on the information selected, the data will be only populated for them. - If no data is found, will show "No Results found" Status Pending - When the request hasn't been fulfilled Complete - When the request has been fulfilled Partial - When the request has been partially fulfilled Rejected - when the request has been denied Expired - When the request start time, date has been passed Two types of section are available; Active and Non Active Request with the count. Active Requests are the ones for which requests are pending or currently running and for upcoming days. Non Active requests are the ones where the request ahs not been fullfiled as it date has been passed or was denied. Table for each section include the same columns as follows: Building - For whom the employee is scheduled for District Manager - Name of the main district manager of the scheduled building Lead- Name of the main lead of the scheduled building Shift Details - Building's shift details appear Request Made - When was the request made with the day, date and time information Work date - For the day, the lumper is requested for, with the days remaining from the current day Lumpers Start Time - From when the schedule lumper will start working Lumper Assigned - The number of requests that were made, how many were approved or not Can click on the number, a pop up opens where you can vie all the lumpers assigned Can click on the red button under unassigned for the lumpers Clicking on the button, the assigned lumper will be unassigned Status - Various types of following status appears for the scheduled Pending - When there is no action on the request Complete - When the request has been fulfilled Partial - When the request has been partially fulfilled Rejected - when the request has been denied Expired - When the request start time, date has been passed Action Notes - As you click on the button, a pop up open to view the details of the scheduled notes. Button would be disabled when no notes have been added and grey when there are notes Check button - To approve the request As you click on the button, the Available lead & lumpers will start appearing proven they fulfil the criteria have the ability to travel selected as yes Distance to be shown, calculating them from selected employee address to selected building address; if it falls under their mentioned range of travel across buildings have them appear in the dropdown Not assigned as the main lead & lumper for the building For the same building and shift can assign the same employee Can search the employee by entering their name Cancel - Blue button to deny the request. The assigned employee will be unassigned. Clicking on yes, would reject the request.
docs.title: Lumper Request

docs.text: When a requests for corrections, the requests appear on the web portal under correction requests. As the new request has been made, a red count appear in the side navigating tab and a rot dot appears beside the new correction request on it's landing page. When there are no correction requests submitted by the lead. "Message when there is no information to display is based on status; For no [Pending Corrections, Corrections Made, Corrections Denied]. The information in table appears as blank with no records as seen in the image. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as to make a correction. Below are the widgets & landing page information as it appears on the landing page Search - search bars which throws result for the below two functions. Customer Search through the name of Customer for whom the request is generated, results will start populating in the table If no information is available, then no records will be shown Search District manager, Lead, Correction For Search through the name building's District manager and lead for whom the request is generated, results will start populating in the table If no information is available, then no records will be shown TThe hierarchy followed for information in listing is Work Date - chronological order Customer - alphabetical order Building - alphabetical order Shift - Day, Swing, Night Department - Operations, Receiving, Shipping Lead - alphabetical order Correction for - alphabetical order The page is divided based on their status into three sections which are as followed and shown in the image with following columns for all. Work date - when the work has been completed by lead on the container. Used abbreviated month name Second column changes based on status Pending correction: Request Made- When the request has been made by lead Corrections Made: Approved On - When the correction were submitted Correction Denied: Not Approved On - When the correction request was denied Customer - Customer name Building - Building Name Shift - Shift of the building Department - Department of the building District Manager - Name of the DM assigned to building Lead - Assigned main lead name comes on the page Correction For - By whom the request has been submitted by Issue - container type appears Status Pending - When the request has been initiated Updated - After after making the desired correction for a request and are submitted Rejected - when the admin or DM denies the correction request Cancelled by lead - wen request has been canceled through lead Action Note Lead correction note pop up opens up which shows the information of the lead such as its container parameters & time clock information Split container button when clicked shows information about the employees who have worked on the container Profile Card Opens a pop up for viewing the contact's information Edit redirects you to make correction page Only available for pending requests Deny A confirmation pop up opens, once you click on yes, a success message appears & redirects you to the listing page. Only available for pending requests Pending Correction: with the count of pending requests for whom no action is taken. When lead requests for correction, it comes under this section Request in 'Correction Made' and 'Correction Denied' tables should display for 14 days from when request was approved/denied. Correction Made: with the count of requests for whom action is taken & submitted. When admin or DM makes the desired correction as stated by lead, then after submission requests move to this section. Once clicked on the edit button, redirect us to the make correction page. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page on how to make a correction. In the first section building info appears with building name, address & associated main lead, customer and its contacts name, shift & shift timings and work date. Only the contacts that have a permission for the corresponding building appears In the second section employee information appears with the name, employee and signature in the title of the table followed by columnar information of status, Type, Container Parameters and notes for customer In the third section, information entered by the lead while creating a request is shown All container parameters and notes saved for customer can be edited. Has the correction been approved by customer pop up opens Once you click on yes for above pop up, another pop up opens to make the correction. Action made on this page reflect on the portal under pending status once you leave or discard the changes by not submitting the changes Submit button stays disable until changes are made. The changes are reflected to lead, admin & DM once they are submitted. Then the requests is move to corrections made section Denied Corrections: with the count of requests which were denied by Admin or DM. Lead gets an email notification after a correction request is approved or denied. From: QHL Support Subject: Correction Request Update Hi [Lead's First Name], Your correction request was Approved. DETAILS Work Date: Thursday, May 6, 2021 Container: Outbound; abcdekmlm 1 (this is container type & #) If approve show all corrections made: CORRECTIONS Container Number: Before: abcdek222 M Correction: abcdekmlm 1 Cases: Before: 1000 Correction: 2222 Reminder: Please ensure lumper's Work Done is updated as well. (This message appears only when cases is edited) Weight: Before: 52 Correction: 30 Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics If the correction request is not approved, the following email notification is shared From: QHL Support Subject: Correction Request Update Hi [Lead's First Name], Your correction request was Not Approved. What is the Correction? Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Please contact your DM if you have any questions or concerns. Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics
docs.title: Landing page

docs.text: Customer Onboarding Sign In As an admin, will be able to sign into the portal using email address and password. By default, Customer dashboard will be selected. To show the field is active and cursor is placed on the field, placeholder would be in blue color, otherwise in grey color. For Customer, Select the customer dashboard Enter the valid email and password and click on sign in, you'll be logged into the portal If the mail entered is of incorrect format or is left blank, will throw a validation message "Email is required and must be of valid format" If the password field is left blank and clicked on sign, will throw a validation error message as "Password is required" If wrong email or password is entered, will throw the notification as "Invalid email or password. Also, ensure the correct dashboard is selected" Forgot Password As you click on the forgot password button, will redirect you the screen to enter the email address in order to receive the reset password email. To show the field is active and cursor is placed on the field, placeholder would be in blue color, otherwise in grey color. Send rest link button would be disable until a valid email address is entered. If the email entered exists in the database, the send rest link button would get activated. With a success notification of "Reset Password link sent to your email", it would redirect us to sign in page. When you enter the wrong email address or leave the field blank, will show a validation error as "Email not found. Please enter a valid email." Reset Password Below is the email template with the link to reset your password From: QHL Support Subject: Reset Password Hi [user's first name], Please use the link below to reset the password for your account. Click here to reset your password *Link access will expire in 48 hours. Thanks Quick Hands Logistics" The link is valid for 48 hours Password should follow the format of minimum 8 characters that includes 1 Uppercase, 1 Lowercase, 1 Special Character, 1 Number, else will throw a validation message Reset button will be disable until the information is entered Will throw a validation error message if the passwords do not match If click on cancel button, will redirect you back to the sign in page To show the field is active and cursor is placed on the field, placeholder would be in blue color, otherwise in grey color. As you click on reset button, will throw a success notification "Password has been updated" and redirect you to the sign in page. Below is the template user receives when they set their password From: QHL Support Subject: Password Updated Hi [user's first name], Your password has been successfully updated! (link to home page of sing-in page here) Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics" User Profile As the Customer clicks on the profile icon on the top, detail information related to the logged in user would appear such as user name and password which can be further viewed and updated. QHL logo will be visible on the top and then their information will be divided into separate sections in the following manner. 1. Profile 2. Change Password 3. Logout Profile Can view the following information Contact's Full Name Profile image Associated Email id Be able to edit the profile information by clicking on the edit button, a pop-up appears with the basic details: Profile Image a. A default profile image appears for the first time. b. Able to upload the profile image by clicking on the red upload button. Clicking on upload, opens the folder from where you can select the desired image. As you have selected the image, the red "change" button activates which lets you change the image (can reselect the same image too) c. After a profile image is uploaded, can also remove the picture by clicking on the grey delete icon. d. As we hover over the deletion icon, it shows the help text " Remove profile photo and return to the default icon" e. Adding a profile image is not a mandatory field to be filled. Information such as First, middle, last name & phone no. are automatically pre-filled. a. The country code for a phone number is fixed as +1 and should be 10 digits. b. The minimum and maximum character limits for entering the name would be 1 and 20. c. Middle name is not a mandatory field to be filled. All the updated information including image, name, and phone no. will be updated only when we click on the update button. A success notification "Contact updated successfully" will appear after successfully updating and reverts us back to the landing page of the section. Change Password As we click on the edit icon, a pop-up appears with the following information 1. Enter the current password 2. Enter new password - retype the new password a. Can type the same password as the current too. 3. The user is prompted with the validations if: a. The current password is wrong as "Invalid Password" b. If the passwords don’t match the newly typed password fields as "Password does not match" c. If the entered password format is wrong as "At least 8 characters that include 1 uppercase, 1 lowercase, 1 special character, 1 number" 4. Update button activates as we type all the information correctly. 5. Success notification as "Password has been changed" appears 6. User is not logged out of the portal. 7. User can also avail the benefit of the forgot password functionality by clicking on the button a. As we hove rover the button, the text changes to blue b. Redirects you to the "Forgot Password" screen Logout As we click on the button, it logs you out and redirects to the login screen with the same dashboard selected. Dashboard Landing page When there are no schedules active in a month, the information on landing shows no records for both kind of view; as list and calendar view as seen in the image. When there are schedules planned in a month, their information appears on the landing page for both kind of view; as list and calendar view. Card information shows the count for the total buildings with work date schedule month and the total work date schedules for the current running month. Section is divided into today, next week and remaining months schedules. (which include the next three week) Table for each section include the same columns as follows - Work date - The day on which the work to be performed for the schedule - Building Name - For whom the work is scheduled for - Shift - Building's shift - Department - Buildings' department - Lead - Main assigned lead for the building - Container Type - Type and quantity of containers scheduled - Total Containers - Total quantity of containers scheduled - Created by - Name of the person who created either customer's contact(managers & supervisors) or lead for the building appears - Status - Various types of following status appears for the scheduled - Scheduled - When the schedule has been created and work has not started. Color code is light blue - Signed - When customer signs customer sheet, it depicts the work has been completed. Color code is dark blue - Overdue- When the scheduled work shift and customer has not signed the customer sheet. Color code is orange. - In Progress - When lumpers starts to work on the first scheduled container. - Completed - When all schedules are in complete status - Cancelled - When not all containers are given a complete status - Terminated - When a schedule has been cancelled by the contact or lead - Unfinished - Has a container that has to be resumed in future - Action - Live Details - As you click on the red network button, you'll be redirected to page where you can view live updates for the current day of a schedule - Schedule Details - As you click on the eye button, you'll be redirected to the schedules details page Work Progress Appears for only the current active day of the schedule A informative section of the building appears on top which consists of the building name, address, Internal Contacts with the pop up to show the contact's name, work date, shift and it's time, department, main lead with the work schedule status A section appears for the container status, how many are scheduled and the count under each status For each container type; a separate section is presented followed by it's detail. The hierarchy followed for this is Outbound, live load and drop The column in the table is as followed Scheduled - The status of the container Fixed container parameters appears which are followed in the listed hierarchy Door, Container Number, Cases, Items/Sort After The fixed containers, additional or customer parameters if any will appear in the columns Worker - Who all worked on the container Start Time - Of the schedule End Time - of the schedule Status - of the container Scheduled Notes If there any notes associated, the button will turn blue and if not then grey As you click on the pop up, the saved note appears. The pop up includes the notes for customer and QHL entered by the lead. Schedules Landing Page When no schedules are scheduled for upcoming days, the landing page appears as shown in the image. You can view the landing page in two views; list view & calendar view. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page. 1. Search - A single search bar which throws result by the building name. Placeholder for the search bar is "Search Building Name" with a search icon. - All Buildings - As you type the respective associated information regarding the entered building name will start appearing in the table. - Search function overwrites the filters. 2. Widgets - Shift - Can select the shifts from the dropdown - Created By - Name of the person who has created the schedule appears in the dropdown - Status - Can filter via status - All Dates - Can search via specific schedule through their work date Table for each section include the same columns as follows Building Name - For whom the work is scheduled for Shift - Building's shift Duration (Repetition)- The duration, custom, weekly or monthly, represented in a date form Total Days - The total for which the schedule is created for Container Type / Duration - Type and quantity of containers scheduled Total Containers / Duration - Total quantity of containers scheduled Created by - Name of the person who created either customer's contact(managers & supervisors) or lead for the building appears Status - Various types of following status appears for the scheduled Scheduled - When the schedule has been created and work has not started. Color code is light blue Signed - When customer signs customer sheet, it depicts the work has been completed. Color code is dark blue Overdue- When the scheduled work shift and customer has not signed the customer sheet. Color code is orange. In Progress - When lumpers starts to work on the first scheduled container. Action Notes - As you click on the button, a pop up open to view the details of the scheduled notes Schedule Details - As you click on the eye button, you'll be redirected to the schedules details page Edit Schedule - Will open a pop up to edit the schedule details. Button will be disable for the current active date schedule Terminate a schedule, means deleting a schedule with a confirmation pop up When you click on the button, the upcoming days after the selected schedule that is to be terminated will automatically be terminated too. You can select specific custom days too for terminating a schedule A schedule automatically moves to non active after the work date has been passed or has been terminated Calendar View - total containers for a building are visible for each day with a combination of all shifts & departments. - When you click on the card for a following, pop up appears with the scheduled information - Can switch between month to see the future schedules Schedule Details Appears for only the upcoming schedules in a month. Can view the landing page in two views. View by Date and by type.in two views. View by Date and by type. As suggested by the name the filtering on the page would be done through upcoming days for the schedule for the former type. for the later type the filtering would eb done based on the container type. A informative section of the building appears which consists of the building name, address,Manager & supervisor's name, work date, shift and it's time, department, main lead, total scheduled containers with the status For each container type; a separate section is presented followed by it's detail. The hierarchy followed for this is Outbound The column in the table is as followed Origin - The status of the container Start Time - Of the schedule Scheduled On - the date it was scheduled Duration - Based on custom, weekly or monthly Created By - By whom it was created Role - Role of the person who created Status - Status of the container Scheduled Notes If there any notes associated, the button will turn blue and if not then grey As you click on the pop up, the saved note appears. Add Schedule By clicking on the add button you'll be able to add a schedule from the next 12hours. The fields are as followed - Building - For the building the contact has permission for will start appearing in the dropdown - Shift - Saved shift for the selected building will be highlighted and can select - Duration - Can select the days for one day, week, month or through custom. - Add Containers - Start time would be specific to the building's shift - Outbound - Clicking on the add container is specific for adding per one row - Can delete the containers from the row - Live Load - Clicking on the add container is specific for adding per one row - Can delete the containers from the row - Drop - Can enter the quantity number at once with the start time - Can delete the containers from the row - Notes - Can enter the notes for the schedule, placeholder text will be grey with the text as "You can enter notes for the QHL Team who will work on the containers in this schedule. - At least a single container is mandatory to be filled with the other building and date information. - The Add schedule button is activated once all mandatory information has been fulfilled. - Once you click on the add schedule button, a confirmation pop up with the schedule details will appear as in the image. - Once you click on the submit, will redirect you to the schedule detail page. Edit Schedule As you click on the edit icon for the schedule. All the dates for the schedule will appear for selected dates. - You cannot edit the building, shift and duration for the schedule - For a a particular container, - can edit the time for the container, once you click on the edit time; a pop up opens with the time as per the building - Can terminate the schedule - Will grey out the whole row for the container as per the container - As you click on terminate, undo cancellation button will appear to revert the changes - Can add more containers - For each day, we have the "View cancelled Containers", the button is activated when the changes have been made after a schedule was created which shows information related to cancelled container - Clicking on the update will open a pop up with the changes made. - After a success notification it will redirect you to the schedule detail page. Whose Working Information is filled only for the current active date when the schedule lead & lumpers attendance through the lead. Based on the permission for the buildings assigned for the contact the information appears on the landing page for each building. 1. Widgets - Shift - All shift options appears in the dropdown - Department - All departments appear int he dropdown 2. Search - Can search for the below two functions: 1. By Name - of employee (lead & lumper) 2. Employee ID - Can search by entering employee ID 3. Listing - 1. Name - of the employee 2. Role - Of the employee 3. Shift - 4. Department 5. Email 6. Phone 7. View ID Customer Sheet Reports Buildings The information for the building for whom the contacts has permission for. Can search for all buildings. the table has the information for the building, the contact has permission for. The table include the following columns - Building Name - City/state - of the building - Internal contacts - Wills show the number which relates to all the contacts for the building - District Manager - Name of the DM - Leads - Assigned main leads for the building will appear. When they are more than one, the number will appear. If you clcik on the number, will open the pop up to view their details - Lumpers - Assigned main lumpers for the building will appear. When they are more than one, the number will appear. If you clcik on the number, will open the pop up to view their details - Shift details - Can click on the view button, will show the information of DM and lead - Action - Eye button to view buildings detail page - Calendar icon to view the schedules for the building - Will redirect to the schedules landing page with the building selected in the search field. the respective information will appear on the page. Internal Contacts Name of all the contacts who are associated/assigned with the same building as contact will appear. Here is the snapshot of the section. 1. Search - By Name, email and phone of the contact. If the relevant searches are found the data will start populating in the table or else will show no records found. 2. Listing - Include following columns 1. Name - Name of the contact 2. Common Building - Buildings name will appear. If the contact shares more than one building then multiple will appear, when clicked will open the pop up with the buildings name. 3. Permissions - If the contact only has view permission for the building then view button will appear. If the contact has both the permission then schedule/view button will appear 4. Email - of the contact will appear 5. Phone - of the contact will appear QHL Contacts Name of all the employee (DM & Lead) who are associated with the building, the contact is assigned to will appear. Here is the snapshot of the section. Search By Name, email and phone of the contact. If the relevant searches are found the data will start populating in the table or else will show no records found. Listing - Include following columns Name - Name of the contact Role - of the employee Building - Buildings name will appear. If the contact shares more than one building then multiple will appear, when clicked will open the pop up with the buildings name. Email - of the contact will appear Phone - of the contact will appear View ID - To download and preview the ID Settings As we navigate to settings through the side navigating tab, we are redirected to Settings landing page. 1. Language a. By default the language selected be english b. Can translate to spanish or english, will change the the words used in the portal accordingly 2. Time Zone a Will be automatically fetched based on user's location as soon as he enables it. 3. Time Format a. Will be able to select from two types of format b. By default the option selected will be 12 hours 4. Changes will be saved only when you click on the red save button
docs.title: Customer

docs.text: As an admin, will be able to sign into the portal using email address and password. By default, Customer dashboard will be selected. To show the field is active and cursor is placed on the field, placeholder would be in blue color, otherwise in grey color. For Customer, Select the customer dashboard Enter the valid email and password and click on sign in, you'll be logged into the portal If the mail entered is of incorrect format or is left blank, will throw a validation message "Email is required and must be of valid format" If the password field is left blank and clicked on sign, will throw a validation error message as "Password is required" If wrong email or password is entered, will throw the notification as "Invalid email or password. Also, ensure the correct dashboard is selected"
docs.title: Sign In

docs.text: As you click on the forgot password button, will redirect you the screen to enter the email address in order to receive the reset password email. To show the field is active and cursor is placed on the field, placeholder would be in blue color, otherwise in grey color. Send rest link button would be disable until a valid email address is entered. If the email entered exists in the database, the send rest link button would get activated. With a success notification of "Reset Password link sent to your email", it would redirect us to sign in page. When you enter the wrong email address or leave the field blank, will show a validation error as "Email not found. Please enter a valid email."
docs.title: Forgot Password

docs.text: Below is the email template with the link to reset your password From: QHL Support Subject: Reset Password Hi [user's first name], Please use the link below to reset the password for your account. Click here to reset your password *Link access will expire in 48 hours. Thanks Quick Hands Logistics" The link is valid for 48 hours Password should follow the format of minimum 8 characters that includes 1 Uppercase, 1 Lowercase, 1 Special Character, 1 Number, else will throw a validation message Reset button will be disable until the information is entered Will throw a validation error message if the passwords do not match If click on cancel button, will redirect you back to the sign in page To show the field is active and cursor is placed on the field, placeholder would be in blue color, otherwise in grey color. As you click on reset button, will throw a success notification "Password has been updated" and redirect you to the sign in page. Below is the template user receives when they set their password From: QHL Support Subject: Password Updated Hi [user's first name], Your password has been successfully updated! (link to home page of sing-in page here) Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics"
docs.title: Reset Password

docs.text: DM Onboarding Sign In As an admin, will be able to sign into the portal using email address and password. By default, Customer dashboard will be selected. To show the field is active and cursor is placed on the field, placeholder would be in blue color, otherwise in grey color. For DM, Select the admin dashboard Enter the valid email and password and click on sign in, you'll be logged into the portal DM receives a mail each time he logs into the portal. If the mail entered is of incorrect format or is left blank, will throw a validation message "Email is required and must be of valid format" If the password field is left blank and clicked on sign, will throw a validation error message as "Password is required" If wrong email or password is entered, will throw the notification as "Invalid email or password. Also, ensure the correct dashboard is selected" Forgot Password As you click on the forgot password button, will redirect you the screen to enter the email address in order to receive the reset password email. To show the field is active and cursor is placed on the field, placeholder would be in blue color, otherwise in grey color. Send rest link button would be disable until a valid email address is entered. If the email entered exists in the database, the send rest link button would get activated. With a success notification of "Reset Password link sent to your email", it would redirect us to sign in page. When you enter the wrong email address or leave the field blank, will show a validation error as "Email not found. Please enter a valid email." Reset Password Below is the email template with the link to reset your password From: QHL Support Subject: Reset Password Hi [user's first name], Please use the link below to reset the password for your account. Click here to reset your password *Link access will expire in 48 hours. Thanks Quick Hands Logistics The link is valid for 48 hours Password should follow the format of minimum 8 characters that includes 1 Uppercase, 1 Lowercase, 1 Special Character, 1 Number, else will throw a validation message Reset button will be disable until the information is entered Will throw a validation error message if the passwords do not match If click on cancel button, will redirect you back to the sign in page To show the field is active and cursor is placed on the field, placeholder would be in blue color, otherwise in grey color. As you click on reset button, will throw a success notification "Password has been updated" and redirect you to the sign in page. Below is the template user receives when they set their password From: QHL Support Subject: Password Updated Hi [user's first name], Your password has been successfully updated! (link to home page of sing-in page here) Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics" User Profile As the DM clicks on the profile icon on the top, detail information related to the logged in user would appear such as user name and password which can be further viewed and updated. QHL logo will be visible on the top and then their information will be divided into separate sections in the following manner. 1. Profile 2. Change Email 3. Change Password 4. Logout Profile Can view the following information Admin's Full Name Admin profile image The role of the admin Associated Email id Be able to edit the profile information by clicking on the edit button, a pop-up appears with the basic details: Profile Image a. A default profile image appears for the first time. b. Able to upload the profile image by clicking on the red upload button. Clicking on upload, opens the folder from where you can select the desired image. As you have selected the image, the red "change" button activates which lets you change the image (can reselect the same image too) c. After a profile image is uploaded, can also remove the picture by clicking on the grey delete icon. d. As we hover over the deletion icon, it shows the help text " Remove profile photo and return to the default icon" e. Adding a profile image is not a mandatory field to be filled. Information such as First, middle, last name & phone no. are automatically pre-filled. a. The country code for a phone number is fixed as +1 and should be 10 digits. b. The minimum and maximum character limits for entering the name would be 1 and 20. c. Middle name is not a mandatory field to be filled. All the updated information including image, name, and phone no. will be updated only when we click on the update button. A success notification "Employee profile updated successfully" will appear after successfully updating and reverts us back to the landing page of the section. Change Email As we click on the edit icon, a pop-up appears with the following information 1. A non editable field for the current email. 2. The password a. Show the current password associated with the account if it is saved on local storage of device. b. If we try to edit/enter the wrong current password, it gives a validation as "Invalid Password" c. Update button will remain disable despite entering the new email. 4. Enter the new email and it should match what we are writing on the “Re-Type New Email”. 5. Will prompt the user with validation if: a. email doesn’t match b. if the email entered is not of a valid format 6. All of the fields are mandatory to be filled 7. After updating all the information with correct current password, the update button becomes activated and by clicking on it, the changes are saved 8. Admin is logged out of the current login session as he updates his email with a successful notification that the email has been updated and to log in again in order to use the portal. 9. On the new email address, the admin receives a mail with the following body Hi [Admin’s Full name], The email associated with your QHL's Admin Dashboard account has been updated. New Email: ______ Please use this new email address to sign into the QHL's Admin Dashboard.Admin Dashboard Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics Change Password As we click on the edit icon, a pop-up appears with the following information 1. Enter the current password 2. Enter new password - retype the new password a. Can type the same password as the current too. 3. The user is prompted with the validations if: a. The current password is wrong as "Invalid Password" b. If the passwords don’t match the newly typed password fields as "Password does not match" c. If the entered password format is wrong as "At least 8 characters that include 1 uppercase, 1 lowercase, 1 special character, 1 number" 4. Update button activates as we type all the information correctly. 5. Success notification as "Password has been changed" appears 6. User is not logged out of the portal. 7. User can also avail the benefit of the forgot password functionality by clicking on the button a. As we hove rover the button, the text changes to blue b. Redirects you to the "Forgot Password" screen Logout As we click on the button, it logs you out and redirects to the login screen with the same dashboard selected. Settings As we navigate to settings through the side navigating tab, we are redirected to Settings landing page. 1. Language a. By default the language selected be english b. Can translate to spanish or english, will change the the words used in the portal accordingly 2. Time Zone a Will be automatically fetched based on user's location as soon as he enables it. 3. Time Format a. Will be able to select from two types of format b. By default the option selected will be 12 hours 4. Notifications a. Can enable or disable the mail notifications to be sent to admin b. Based on his permission, they will be able to receive mails for two cases i. When a read requests a lumper ii. When lead request for a correction 5. Changes will be saved only when you click on the red save button Customer As we navigate to customers through side navigating tab, we are redirected to it's landing page only for the building the DM is assigned to. Landing page The page start with the title Customers and 'i' button which when clicked, gives you an insight of the section, such as to add / edit customer, make them non active or delete, and view their detail page. A red + button to add a customer. Widgets - For selecting the information specific to their status if they are active, non active or both By default the option selected will be "Active and Non Active Customers" Can select more options from the dropdown; Active Customers and Non Active Customers Hierarchy is as shown Search Placeholder for the search bar is "Select Customer in the Selected Type" with a search icon. Based on the filter selected, the data will be only populated for them. For example: If you have selected "Non Active Customers" as a filter and type the name of the customers in the search field. If the customer you are searching for belongs to Non Active, they will appear in the table otherwise "No Results Found" will appear. Active Customers The number of customers who are active appears on the top of table and the associated data will appear in the table. The table consists of followings columns with their title in bold and the information in regular text. Customer Will show the names of the customers. If click on the name, a pop up comes with the following info. If we click on the customer name inside the pop up, it will redirect to the their detail page. Buildings Will show the name of building associated with the customer If click on the name, a pop up comes with the following info. "Multiple" appears if more than one building is associated with the customer, if we click on it, will open a pop up as shown in the image If we click on the building name inside the pop up, it will redirect to the their detail page. Managers & Supervisors Will show the name of managers,supervisor associated with the customer. If click on the name, a pop up comes with the following info. "Count" appears if more than one manager is associated with the customer, if we click on it, will open a pop up as shown in the image. If we click on the manager name inside the pop up, it will redirect to the the customer detail page. Active Since Automatically fetches the date when customer was created. Format of showing date will be "Full month name Date, Year" Action - As we hover over icons, the functionality of them appears in a text form Eye Icon button -> Redirects to their detail page Edit Icon button -> Opens pop up to edit customer details Orange Cross button -> To make a customer non active All Contacts and buildings need to be made Non Active before allowing a Customer Profile to become Non Active. Error message appears when Non Active (orange x) is clicked on a Customer profile that has an active Building and/or Contact. Pagination is implemented which lets you choose how many items to display in a table, by default it's set to 10. Non Active Customers The number of customers who are non active appears on the top of table and the associated data will appear in the table. Hierarchy Order for Non Active Customer is listed by Non Active Since date (reverse chronological order; Present - past) Customer Name (alphabetical order) Same information in tables as for "Active Customers" Non Active Since -> Fetches the date when the customer profile was made non active. Action Green Turn around button -> To reactive the customer Red Cross Button -> To delete a customer; can renter the same information for new profile Delete the profiles from the Customers and Building sections from the listing Delete all its buildings profiles Delete all its contacts profiles Delete Customer (work) Schedules for future dates (for corresponding buildings). Unassign QHL Employees; DM, Leads, and lumpers (from corresponding buildings). Pagination is implemented which lets you choose how many items to display in a table, by default it's set to 10 items per page. Add Customer As we click on the red add button, a pop up appears A default profile image appears for the first time. Able to upload the profile image by clicking on the red upload button. Clicking on upload, opens the folder from where you can select the desired image. As you have selected the image, the red "change" button activates which lets you change the image (can reselect the same image too) After a profile image is uploaded, can also remove the picture by clicking on the grey delete icon. As we hover over the deletion icon, it shows the help text " Remove profile photo and return to the default icon" Adding a profile image is not a mandatory field to be filled. Minimum 1 and maximum 50 characters can be added in name field, which accepts alphabets, spaces, numbers and special characters. As you enter the name, red button becomes activated. Cannot enter space as the first character, if added before a name, would discard the spaces entered. If you click on cross button, it shows the pop up to either discard or keep on editing. If you click on discard, it will revert you back to the landing page If you click on continue, it will keep the pop up open Edit Customer As we click on the edit icon, a pop up appears A default profile image appears if you haven't uploaded any image. As you have selected the image, the red "change" button activates which lets you change the image (can reselect the same image too) After a profile image is uploaded, can also remove the picture by clicking on the grey delete icon. Minimum 1 and maximum 50 characters can be added in name field, which accepts alphabets, spaces, numbers and special characters. As you enter the name, red update button becomes activated.
