Last Name - A mandatory field The minimum and maximum character limits for entering the name would be 1 and 20. Email - A mandatory field, will throw an error when the email entered is not of a proper format. Phone No. - A mandatory 10 digit field, can copy paste a phone no. too. Role - Select a role from managers or supervisors Title - Enter the title respective to the contact you are creating, of minimum 20 characters Shift - A mandatory field to select a shift from all, day, swing and night in the mentioned order Department - not a mandatory field to be filled, by default operations department will be selected. Administrative Permissions Clicking on the edit icon will open section to remove or add permission for a building Can give a contact the permission to either view building details, create schedules or do both for them by clicking on add radio button and selecting the building for which you want Can remove the permission to either view building details, create schedules or both for them by clicking on remove radio button and selecting the building for which you want View current permission - clicking on the button will open a pop up with the buildings and associated permissions When we are creating a contact for the first time If there is no building, then after a building has been created, by default their administrative permissions are updated to view buildings and create schedules for them If a building already exists, we have to give the administrative permissions to the contact Here is the associated email format, when permissions are given or updated Hi [Contact Name], The administrative permissions associated with your QHL's Customer Dashboard account have been updated. New Permissions: View Buildings/Contacts/QHL Employee ID: No Create Work Schedules: No Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics Edit Contact All the information for the contact are pre-saved and appears in the field. As you click on the field, you can edit the text as shown in image The update button remains activated even when no changes have been made, clicking on the button, will redirect you to contacts listing with a success notification Add Building Clicking on the add building button, will redirect you to the section to add building details as shown in the image. The fields associated while entering the details are as followed Customer To select the name of the customer from the dropdown, all active contacts appear in the dropdown A mandatory field Building Name / Identification Enter the building name you want to associate with a customer Minimum 1 and maximum 20 characters are allowed including, space and numbers as well. Can be same as previous A mandatory field Building Phone Enter the phone number directly or through pasting The country code for a phone number is fixed as +1 and the number should be 10 digits. A mandatory and unique field Building Address Maximum 1 and minimum 50 characters are allowed which includes space, numbers and symbols A mandatory field Zip Code, State & City Minimum 4 & 5 digits of Zip Code can be entered As you enter the correct Zip Code, the state & city associated will be prefilled in their respective fields If the Zip Code entered is incorrect, it will throw you an error that Zip Code doesn't match with our records A mandatory field Manager / Supervisor Once you click on the select, the list of associated contacts with the customers appears You can click on the add new button, to add a contact As you have select the add new button, it open the pop up with role automatically selected depending from where you have selected the option A mandatory field District Manager You can select multiple DM's from the list You cannot select a DM or DM will not appear unless you add a Zip Code DM are appeared in the list when you have added them for the districts If you haven't added any DM associated with the Zip Code you are entering for the building, no DM will appear in the dropdown A mandatory field QHL Office All the saved QHL office will appear in the dropdown A mandatory field Shift detail - As you select a shift, the section expands to save the shift details, which includes [Shift Name] Time - Select from the dropdown the start & end time which ranges from 12am to 11:30pm Department Operations will be selected by default If you select Receiving / shipping as department, lead & lumpers will be separately selected for each department receiving & shipping QHL Lead - Click on the add button, you can search by lead name, and as you increase the distance filter the leads name will start appearing QHL Lumpers - Click on the add button, you can search by lumper name, and as you increase the distance filter the lumpers name will start appearing If no results are found, a message is displayed A mandatory field You can select multiple (all three shifts) or one, depending upon the shifts selected the detail section to include leads & lumpers will appear. Empty Container Report - you can choose whom to send reports when the containers for a schedule are completed as per customize format and the mail frequency By default no will be selected and and when yes is selected, the section expands to set the frequency of email When yes is selected, you can select the contact from the dropdown for which you choose to send the reports As you click on the customize email subject and message, a pop up opens which lets you edit the saved draft of subject and message body You can select the document type to be sent with email from pdf, excel or both You can set the frequency as per the day you want to receive emails. You can either select the work date or can customize the day you want to receive emails By default, 'Monday - Friday' will be selected. As you click on the edit button, a pop up opens which lets you choose from options as selecting specific days and how many weeks. Week period includes options from 1 - 4 You can either select the monthly option, and set the frequency as per the days and the frequency between months. Monthly interval period would range from 1 - 12. Days for the month will have option from all 1st - 31th. ID - Unique ID associated with employee will appear Phone - Unique phone number associated with employee will appear Email - Unique email associated with employee will appear Residence - State and city with respect to the building address will appear Active Since Automatically fetches the date when employee was created. Format of showing date will be "Full month name, Date, Year" Action - As we hover over icons, the functionality of them appears in a text form Eye Icon button -> Redirects to their detail page Edit Icon button -> Opens pop up to edit customer details Orange Cross button -> To make a employee non active Employees need to be unassigned in order to make them Non Active. Error message appears when Non Active (orange x) is clicked for employee that is assigned to a building Send credentials button appears for DM and Lead profile, an email is send with respect to their status if the employee has already verify email and set-up a password. If employee has NOT verified email and set-up a password, then send Email Verification and Password Set-Up If employee verify email but has not set-up a password, then send 'Set Password' email If a employee has already verified email and set-up a password, then send a 'Reset Password' email When clicked on ID button, ID pop uos gets open up which can be further generated Pagination is implemented which lets you choose how many items to display in a table, by default it's set to 10. Non Active Employees The number of employees who are non active appears on the top of table and the associated data will appear in the table. Add Employee You can view the form with following fields for entering the information in order to add an employee. First Name - A mandatory field Middle Name - not a mandatory field to be filled. Last Name - A mandatory field The minimum and maximum character limits for entering the name would be 1 and 20. Email - A mandatory unique field, will throw an error when the email entered is not of a proper format. Phone No. - A mandatory 10 digit unique field, can copy paste a phone no. too. Address - Residential address of the employee. Maximum 1 and minimum 50 characters are allowed which includes space, numbers and symbols A mandatory field Zip Code, State & City Minimum 4 & 5 digits of Zip Code can be entered As you enter the correct Zip Code, the staTe & city associated will be prefilled in their respective fields If the Zip Code entered is incorrect, it will throw you an error that Zip Code doesn't match with our records. Foe eg: 07041 is considered as an incorrect Zip Code A mandatory field Preferred Contact Method You can select your preferable mode from phone (as text message), through email or both in order to receive updates By default, email will be selected Work Identification - Employee ID - A unique 7 digit employee ID will be generated for every employee which is a combination of three alphabets and four numbers. A mandatory field Role - Can select a role from District Manager, Lead and Lumper. A mandatory field Title - Enter the title respective to the employee you are creating, of minimum 20 characters. Job Description - You can create a detail description related to the role you have selected. Work Availability Availability By default, full time will be selected by default. Can select from either full time or part time Shift Availability By default, day will be selected as the default shift A mandatory field to select a shift from all, day, swing and night in the mentioned order Can only select only one field Availability Notes Can create a detail description related to the role you have selected. Travel Details Ability to travel between buildings By default, no would be selected by default If you have selected no and yes, then based on the selection, they will appear in the building and for the requests for a lumper or assigned them as temporary Miles Radius from primary building / Residence If yes has been selected, you can enter the miles up to 60 It is used when we want to filter the employees based on their distance while adding to the building Travel Notes Can create a detail description related from the travel perspective you have selected Miscellaneous Date Hired - Can select from previous and today's date Notes - Can create a detail description related to the employee profile you have selected As you click on add, the changes are saved and redirects you to the listing page. Based on the role you have selected, you'll receive following emails of information regarding your account creation and setup. Here is the associated email format, when DM profile is created "Hi [DM's First Name], Congratulations. Your QHL account has been created. Click here to verify email and create a password *Link expires in 48 hours. After you set-up your password, you'll be able to sign into the QHL's Admin Dashboard to see information for your buildings. (Admin Portal website link will be place here as a hyperlink). Please contact your QHL Office, if you have any questions or need help. Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics" Here is the associated email format, when Lead profile is created "Hi [Lead's First Name], Congratulations. Your QHL account has been created. Click here to activate your account and set a password *Link expires in 48 hours. After you activate your account , you'll be able to sign into the QHL's mobile app to manage work information for your QHL team. Please contact your QHL District Manager, if you have any questions or need help. Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics" Here is the associated email format, when Lumper profile is created "From: QHL Support Subject: Account Created ---- Hello [Lumper's first Name], Your account with QHL has been created. You will be receiving work notifications by [Preferred Contact Method]. Speak with your QHL District Manager if you would like to change to a different method. Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics" Here is the associated email format, when employee profile is created " From: QHL Support Subject: Account Updated ---- Hello [Employee's first Name], Your account has been updated. Updated [Role/Phone/Email/Address]: Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics" Edit Employee All the information for the employee are pre-saved and appears in the field. As you click on the field, you can edit the text as shown in image. The update button remains disabled even when no changes have been made, clicking on the button, will redirect you to employees listing with a success notification. Email are sent across when the following are updated Email, Role, Phone, Email and address are changed Here is the associated email format, when employee profile is created " From: QHL Support Subject: Account Updated ---- Hello [Employee's first Name], Your account has been updated. Updated [Role/Phone/Email/Address]: Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics" Employee Detail Page The employee details can be viewed by clicking on the eye icon as shown in the image . A back button which redirects you to the listing of buildings. An edit icon which lets you edit building details. The employee name appears on the top of the page with the email address, phone, residential address (including state, city and Zip Code) and proffered contact Method Work Identification Unique employee ID will appear Role selected will appear If Title and description have information, their information will appear otherwise it would be blank Work Availability Availability - The availability selected will appear Shift Availability - The shift selected will appear If Availability notes have information, then it will appear otherwise it would be blank Travel Details Ability to travel between buildings - the option you have selected will appear If you have selected no, the the blank information will appear for the rest of the fields If you have selected yes, the respectively information will appear for Miles radius and travel notes Miscellaneous Date hired & notes will appear in the this section Assigned Customer and building details for whom the employee is assigned to. When there are no schedules(current and upcoming) active in a month including, the information on landing shows no records for both kind of view as seen in the image As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page. For showing the total customers, employees and buildings on the admin portal through three cards. Section is divided into today, next week and remaining months schedules (which include the next three week) Table for each section include the same columns as follows Work date - The day on which the work to be performed for the schedule Building Name - For whom the work is scheduled for Shift - Building's shift Department - Buildings' department Container Type - Type and quantity of containers scheduled Total Containers - Total quantity of containers scheduled Created by - Name of the person who created either customer's contact(managers & supervisors) or lead for the building appears Status - Various types of following status appears for the scheduled Scheduled - When the schedule has been created and work has not started. Color code is light blue Signed - When customer signs customer sheet, it depicts the work has been completed. Color code is dark blue Overdue- When the scheduled work shift and customer has not signed the customer sheet. Color code is orange. In Progress - When lumpers starts to work on the first scheduled container. Completed - When all schedules are in complete status Cancelled - When not all containers are given a complete status Terminated - When a schedule has been cancelled by the contact or lead Unfinished - Has a container that has to be resumed in future Action Live Details - As you click on the red network button, you'll be redirected to page where you can view live updates for the current day of a schedule Schedule Details - As you click on the eye button, you'll be redirected to the schedules details page Calendar View total containers for a building are visible for each day with a combination of all shifts & departments. When you click on the card for a following, pop up appears with the scheduled information Can switch between month to see the future schedules Work progress Live details of the schedule as the container status's keep on updating Appears for only the current active day of the schedule A informative section of the building appears on top which consists of the building name, address, Manager & supervisor's name, work date, shift and it's time, department, main lead with the work schedule status A section appears for the container status, how many are scheduled and the count under each status For each container type; a separate section is presented followed by it's detail. The hierarchy followed for this is Outbound, live load and drop The column in the table is as followed Scheduled - The status of the container Fixed container parameters appears which are followed in the listed hierarchy Door, Container Number, Cases, Items/Sort After The fixed containers, additional or customer parameters if any will appear in the columns Worker - Who all worked on the container Start Time - Of the schedule End Time - of the schedule Status - of the container Scheduled Notes If there any notes associated, the button will turn blue and if not then grey As you click on the pop up, the saved note appears. The following column appear for the container type Origin - by whom it was added Fixed container parameters appears which are followed in the listed hierarchy Door, Container Number, Cases, Items/Sort After The fixed containers, additional or customer parameters if any will appear in the columns Status Cancelled - When the container has been moved to cancel state. All work done has to be completed Unfinished - When the container has been moved to unfinished state, has work remaining to be done. Remaining work is scheduled to be completed in upcoming days Not Open - When the container has been moved to Not open state. Buildings appear based on the above filters applied - Select the desired shift & departments - Select the date range (start & end) from the calendar pop up - By default, the current date appears - Start & End date can be same 2. As per the selected filters, information starts to appear in the next section which is again divided into three tabs. Hierarchy order for listing within each column is as followed - Customer (alphabetical) - Building (alphabetical) - Shift (Day, Swing, Night) - Department (Operations, Receiving, Shipping) - Leads (alphabetical order) - Lumpers (alphabetical order) - role (lead, Lumpers) - name (alphabetical order) Reports Landing Page As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page for whom you can download and view the report. Name - Name of the employee for which the attendance is clocked in for ID - Employee Id is shown Role - The role of the clocked in employee Clocked In - When he clocks into the portal Clocked Out - When he clocks out of the portal Total time - calculated between the clock in & clock out time Lunch Start - Time when lunch break started Lunch end - Time when lunch break was end Total Lunch - calculated between the lunch start & lunch end time Reg Time Work Time OT DOT Signature Pending - When the customer hasn't signed the lumper sheet Signed - When the customer has signed the lumper sheet Note - If the notes were saved while adding the attendance will appear in and the button will turn blue or else grey If no information is there for time then -- appears Hierarchy order for listing within each column is as followed role (lead, Lumpers) name (alphabetical order) Lumper Sheet Report: Item Selection Customer Sheet Report: Item Selection Empty Container Report: Item Selection As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing empty container report or generate it. Follows the format as year, month, date Customer - Name of the customer will appear Building - building name will appear Shift - shift name will appear Department - department name will appear Leads - Name of the lead will appear Container - container details entered for the completed container will appear You can either select any particular row or can select all Hierarchy Order in listing is as followed Shift - Day, Swing, Night Department - Operations, Receiving, Shipping Empty Containers Report: View The page is divided into separate section which includes the building details with ready to export functionality and for the container type details The first section - Building details consists of Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button Generate button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report Building details which includes Building Name - with the complete address Customer Name Shift - Shift of the building Manager - Name of the manager Department - full name of the department appears Supervisor - Name of the supervisor Reports Date Range - The selected date range will appear in month, date & year format The next section includes the empty container title with count type for containers with complete status. The following column appears. Date - full date available with day, month, date & year Door - Information added by lead for entering container parameters Container - Information added by lead for entering container parameters Time Emptied - When the container was given a complete status Hierarchy order for listing is Date (chronological order) Time Emptied (alphabetical order ) Door (alphabetical order, number order) Container# (alphabetical order, number order) " Customer List: Item Selection As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing customer lists item selection or generate it. The page is divided into separate section which includes the selection section and the associated filtered results The first includes the selection of building through the following Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button Generate & generate summary button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) Buttons will be activate once you select the desired row on tab Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report Select desired state & city Able to filter the list by dates the date range (start & end) from the calendar pop up By default, All dates radio button is selected Can select year Can select the custom date range (start & end) from the calendar pop up By default, the current date appears Start & End date can be same As per the selected filters, information starts to appear in the next section which is again divided into two tabs. If no information is available, no records found message appears First Tab - Active - All active customers will appear The following columns appear Customer - Name of the customer will appear Building - count of the building Managers - count of the manager Supervisor - count of the supervisor Active Since - date the customer profile is active since You can either select any particular row or can select all Second Tab - Non Active - All non active employees will appear The following columns appear Customer - Name of the customer will appear Building - count of the building Managers - count of the manager Supervisor - count of the supervisor Non Active Since - date the customer profile was made non active You can either select any particular row or can select all Employees List: Item Selection As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing employees lists item selection or generate it. The page is divided into separate section which includes the selection section and the associated filtered results The first includes the selection of building through the following Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button Generate & generate summary button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) Buttons will be activate once you select the desired row on tab Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report Customer - Name of the customer will appear Building - building name will appear Role - All roles of the employee will appear and can select from the dropdown Select desired state & city Able to filter the list by dates the date range (start & end) from the calendar pop up By default, All dates radio button is selected Can select year Can select the custom date range (start & end) from the calendar pop up By default, the current date appears Start & End date can be same As per the selected filters, information starts to appear in the next section which is again divided into two tabs. If no information is available, no records found message appears First Tab - Active - All active employees will appear with the total count in header The following columns appear Name - name of the employee will appear ID - Unique ID associated with employee will appear Phone - Unique phone number associated with employee will appear Email - Unique email associated with employee will appear Role - Role of the employee appears Work Location - The address sof the building employee is assigned to appears Active Since - date the customer profile is active since You can either select any particular row or can select all Second Tab - Non Active - All non active employees will appear with the total count in header The following columns appear Name - name of the employee will appear ID - Unique ID associated with employee will appear Phone - Unique phone number associated with employee will appear Email - Unique email associated with employee will appear Role - Role of the employee appears Work Location - The address sof the building employee is assigned to appears Non Active Since - date the customer profile was made non active You can either select any particular row or can select all Temporary Lumper Landing Page When there are no lead and lumpers scheduled as temporary for a building only for the building the DM is assigned to. The information in table appears as blank with no records as seen in the image. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as adding, cancelling or unassign a lumper Search - search bars which throws result for the below two functions. All Buildings As you type the respective associated information regarding the entered building name will start appearing in the table. If no data is available then no records will be shown Search function overwrites the filters. Search Lumper, Lead Search through the name of lead and lumpers that are temporarily scheduled, results will start populating in the table If no information is available, then no records will be shown Widgets Shift - Can select the shifts from the dropdown District Managers - Name of the person who has created the schedule appears in the dropdown Department - can select departments from the dropdown All Dates - Can search via specific schedule through their work date Two types of section are available; Scheduled and expired Schedules with the count. Schedules are the ones which are active and running for the current and upcoming days. Expired are the ones where the schedule was cancelled or the work date has been passed. Table for each section include the same columns as follows Temp lumpers - Name of the employee(lead & Lumper) Sent to Building - For whom the employee is scheduled for District Manager - Name of the main district manager of the scheduled building Lead- Name of the main lead of the scheduled building Shift Details - Building's shift details appear Assigned By - Name of the person who assigned Date Assigned - When the employee was added as temporary Work date - For the day, teh lumper is assigned Start Time - From when the schedule lumper will start Status - Various types of following status appears for the scheduled Scheduled - When the schedule has been created and work has not started. Cancelled - When the temporary lumper request has been cancelled by admin or DM. Completed - When the scheduled work for the temporary lumper has been completed. Action Notes - As you click on the button, a pop up open to view the details of the scheduled notes. Button would be disabled when no notes have been added and grey when there are notes Edit - Edit button to edit the schedule details Cancel - Blue cross button to cancel the schedule. The assigned temporary employee will be unassigned Add Temporary Lumper To add a lead or lumper on temporary basis only for the building the DM is assigned to, a pop up opens when you click on the add button. The fields are as follows: Customer Start typing the customer name, relevant names would appear in the dropdown and can select from the dropdown. Search will start appearing once you enter the first alphabet Building Respective building under the customer name wills start appearing Shift - The selected shift for the building will start appearing Department - The selected department will start appearing for the selected building Select lumpers Available lead & lumpers will start appearing proven they fulfil the criteria that they have the ability to travel selected as yes Distance to be shown, calculating them from selected employee address to selected building address; if it falls under their mentioned range of travel across buildings have them appear in the dropdown Not assigned as the main lead & lumper for the building For the same building and shift can assign the same employee Can search the employee by entering their name Work Duration - Based on custom, weekly, day or monthly Start time - Only shows the range selected for the building Notes - Enter the notes for the temporary schedule lumper Schedule button remains deactivated until all information is fulfilled, with a success notification it redirects you back to the listing page. All are mandatory field except notes Lumper Request When a lead requests for lumper, the requests appear on the web portal under lumper requests only for the building the DM is assigned to. As the new request has been made, a red count appear in the side navigating tab and a rot dot appears beside the new lumper request on it's landing page. When there are no lead and lumpers scheduled as temporary for a building. The information in table appears as blank with no records as seen in the image. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as to fulfil a request partially or fully. Search - search bars which throws result for the below two functions. All Buildings As you type the respective associated information regarding the entered building name will start appearing in the table. If no data is available then no records will be shown Search function overwrites the filters. Customer Search through the name of Customer for whom the request is generated, results will start populating in the table If no information is available, then no records will be shown Search Customer, building District manager, Lead Search through the name of Customer, building District manager and lead for whom the request is generated, results will start populating in the table If no information is available, then no records will be shown Widgets Select state & city Status Pending - When the request hasn't been fulfilled Complete - When the request has been fulfilled Partial - When the request has been partially fulfilled Rejected - when the request has been denied Expired - When the request start time, date has been passed Two types of section are available; Active and Non Active Request with the count. Active Requests are the ones for which requests are pending or currently running and for upcoming days. Non Active requests are the ones where the request ahs not been fullfiled as it date has been passed or was denied. Table for each section include the same columns as follows Building - For whom the employee is scheduled for District Manager - Name of the main district manager of the scheduled building Lead- Name of the main lead of the scheduled building Shift Details - Building's shift details appear Request Made - When was the request made with the day, date and time information Work date - For the day, the lumper is requested for, with the days remaining from the current day Lumpers Start Time - From when the schedule lumper will start working Lumper Assigned - The number of requests that were made, how many were approved or not Can click on the number, a pop up opens where you can vie all the lumpers assigned Can click on the red button under unassigned for the lumpers Clicking on the button, the assigned lumper will be unassigned Status - Various types of following status appears for the scheduled Pending - When there is no action on the request Complete - When the request has been fulfilled Partial - When the request has been partially fulfilled Rejected - when the request has been denied Expired - When the request start time, date has been passed Action Notes - As you click on the button, a pop up open to view the details of the scheduled notes. Button would be disabled when no notes have been added and grey when there are notes Check button - To approve the request As you click on the button, the Available lead & lumpers will start appearing proven they fulfil the criteria have the ability to travel selected as yes Distance to be shown, calculating them from selected employee address to selected building address; if it falls under their mentioned range of travel across buildings have them appear in the dropdown Not assigned as the main lead & lumper for the building For the same building and shift can assign the same employee Can search the employee by entering their name Cancel - Blue button to deny the request. The assigned employee will be unassigned. Clicking on yes, would reject the request. Correction Request Landing page When a requests for corrections is made through lead only for the building the DM is assigned to, the requests appear on the web portal under correction requests. As the new request has been made, a red count appear in the side navigating tab and a rot dot appears beside the new correction request on it's landing page. When there are no correction requests submitted by the lead. "Message when there is no information to display is based on status; For no [Pending Corrections, Corrections Made, Corrections Denied]. The information in table appears as blank with no records as seen in the image. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as to make a correction. Below are the widgets & landing page information as it appears on the landing page Search - search bars which throws result for the below two functions. Customer Search through the name of Customer for whom the request is generated, results will start populating in the table If no information is available, then no records will be shown Search District manager, Lead, Correction For Search through the name building's District manager and lead for whom the request is generated, results will start populating in the table If no information is available, then no records will be shown TThe hierarchy followed for information in listing is Work Date - chronological order Customer - alphabetical order Building - alphabetical order Shift - Day, Swing, Night Department - Operations, Receiving, Shipping Lead - alphabetical order Correction for - alphabetical order The page is divided based on their status into three sections which are as followed and shown in the image with following columns for all. Work date - when the work has been completed by lead on the container. Used abbreviated month name Second column changes based on status Pending correction: Request Made- When the request has been made by lead Corrections Made: Approved On - When the correction were submitted Correction Denied: Not Approved On - When the correction request was denied Customer - Customer name Building - Building Name Shift - Shift of the building Department - Department of the building District Manager - Name of the DM assigned to building Lead - Assigned main lead name comes on the page Correction For - By whom the request has been submitted by Issue - container type appears Status Pending - When the request has been initiated Updated - After after making the desired correction for a request and are submitted Rejected - when the admin or DM denies the correction request Cancelled by lead - wen request has been canceled through lead Action Note Lead correction note pop up opens up which shows the information of the lead such as its container parameters & time clock information Split container button when clicked shows information about the employees who have worked on the container Profile Card Opens a pop up for viewing the contact's information Edit redirects you to make correction page Only available for pending requests Deny A confirmation pop up opens, once you click on yes, a success message appears & redirects you to the listing page. Only available for pending requests Pending Correction: with the count of pending requests for whom no action is taken. When lead requests for correction, it comes under this section Request in 'Correction Made' and 'Correction Denied' tables should display for 14 days from when request was approved/denied. Correction Made: with the count of requests for whom action is taken & submitted. When admin or DM makes the desired correction as stated by lead, then after submission requests move to this section. Once clicked on the edit button, redirect us to the make correction page. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page on how to make a correction. In the first section building info appears with building name, address & associated main lead, customer and its contacts name, shift & shift timings and work date. Only the contacts that have a permission for the corresponding building appears In the second section employee information appears with the name, employee and signature in the title of the table followed by columnar information of status, Type, Container Parameters and notes for customer In the third section, information entered by the lead while creating a request is shown All container parameters and notes saved for customer can be edited. Has the correction been approved by customer pop up opens Once you click on yes for above pop up, another pop up opens to make the correction. Action made on this page reflect on the portal under pending status once you leave or discard the changes by not submitting the changes Submit button stays disable until changes are made. The changes are reflected to lead, admin & DM once they are submitted. Then the requests is move to corrections made section Denied Corrections: with the count of requests which were denied by Admin or DM. Lead gets an email notification after a correction request is approved or denied. From: QHL Support Subject: Correction Request Update Hi [Lead's First Name], Your correction request was Approved. DETAILS Work Date: Thursday, May 6, 2021 Container: Outbound; abcdekmlm 1 (this is container type & #) If approve show all corrections made: CORRECTIONS Container Number: Before: abcdek222 M Correction: abcdekmlm 1 Cases: Before: 1000 Correction: 2222 Reminder: Please ensure lumper's Work Done is updated as well. (This message appears only when cases is edited) Weight: Before: 52 Correction: 30 Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics If the correction request is not approved, the following email notification is shared From: QHL Support Subject: Correction Request Update Hi [Lead's First Name], Your correction request was Not Approved. What is the Correction? Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Please contact your DM if you have any questions or concerns. Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics
docs.title: District Manager

docs.text: As an admin, will be able to sign into the portal using email address and password. By default, Customer dashboard will be selected. To show the field is active and cursor is placed on the field, placeholder would be in blue color, otherwise in grey color. For DM, Select the admin dashboard Enter the valid email and password and click on sign in, you'll be logged into the portal DM receives a mail each time he logs into the portal. If the mail entered is of incorrect format or is left blank, will throw a validation message "Email is required and must be of valid format" If the password field is left blank and clicked on sign, will throw a validation error message as "Password is required" If wrong email or password is entered, will throw the notification as "Invalid email or password. Also, ensure the correct dashboard is selected"
docs.title: Sign In

docs.text: As you click on the forgot password button, will redirect you the screen to enter the email address in order to receive the reset password email. To show the field is active and cursor is placed on the field, placeholder would be in blue color, otherwise in grey color. Send rest link button would be disable until a valid email address is entered. If the email entered exists in the database, the send rest link button would get activated. With a success notification of "Reset Password link sent to your email", it would redirect us to sign in page. When you enter the wrong email address or leave the field blank, will show a validation error as "Email not found. Please enter a valid email."
docs.title: Forgot Password

docs.text: Below is the email template with the link to reset your password From: QHL Support Subject: Reset Password Hi [user's first name], Please use the link below to reset the password for your account. Click here to reset your password *Link access will expire in 48 hours. Thanks Quick Hands Logistics The link is valid for 48 hours Password should follow the format of minimum 8 characters that includes 1 Uppercase, 1 Lowercase, 1 Special Character, 1 Number, else will throw a validation message Reset button will be disable until the information is entered Will throw a validation error message if the passwords do not match If click on cancel button, will redirect you back to the sign in page To show the field is active and cursor is placed on the field, placeholder would be in blue color, otherwise in grey color. As you click on reset button, will throw a success notification "Password has been updated" and redirect you to the sign in page. Below is the template user receives when they set their password From: QHL Support Subject: Password Updated Hi [user's first name], Your password has been successfully updated! (link to home page of sing-in page here) Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics"
docs.title: Reset Password

docs.text: As the DM clicks on the profile icon on the top, detail information related to the logged in user would appear such as user name and password which can be further viewed and updated. QHL logo will be visible on the top and then their information will be divided into separate sections in the following manner. 1. Profile 2. Change Email 3. Change Password 4. Logout
docs.title: User Profile

docs.text: Can view the following information Admin's Full Name Admin profile image The role of the admin Associated Email id Be able to edit the profile information by clicking on the edit button, a pop-up appears with the basic details: Profile Image a. A default profile image appears for the first time. b. Able to upload the profile image by clicking on the red upload button. Clicking on upload, opens the folder from where you can select the desired image. As you have selected the image, the red "change" button activates which lets you change the image (can reselect the same image too) c. After a profile image is uploaded, can also remove the picture by clicking on the grey delete icon. d. As we hover over the deletion icon, it shows the help text " Remove profile photo and return to the default icon" e. Adding a profile image is not a mandatory field to be filled. Information such as First, middle, last name & phone no. are automatically pre-filled. a. The country code for a phone number is fixed as +1 and should be 10 digits. b. The minimum and maximum character limits for entering the name would be 1 and 20. c. Middle name is not a mandatory field to be filled. All the updated information including image, name, and phone no. will be updated only when we click on the update button. A success notification "Employee profile updated successfully" will appear after successfully updating and reverts us back to the landing page of the section.
docs.title: Profile

docs.text: As we click on the edit icon, a pop-up appears with the following information 1. A non editable field for the current email. 2. The password a. Show the current password associated with the account if it is saved on local storage of device. b. If we try to edit/enter the wrong current password, it gives a validation as "Invalid Password" c. Update button will remain disable despite entering the new email. 4. Enter the new email and it should match what we are writing on the “Re-Type New Email”. 5. Will prompt the user with validation if: a. email doesn’t match b. if the email entered is not of a valid format 6. All of the fields are mandatory to be filled 7. After updating all the information with correct current password, the update button becomes activated and by clicking on it, the changes are saved 8. Admin is logged out of the current login session as he updates his email with a successful notification that the email has been updated and to log in again in order to use the portal. 9. On the new email address, the admin receives a mail with the following body Hi [Admin’s Full name], The email associated with your QHL's Admin Dashboard account has been updated. New Email: ______ Please use this new email address to sign into the QHL's Admin Dashboard.Admin Dashboard Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics
docs.title: Change Email

docs.text: As we click on the edit icon, a pop-up appears with the following information 1. Enter the current password 2. Enter new password - retype the new password a. Can type the same password as the current too. 3. The user is prompted with the validations if: a. The current password is wrong as "Invalid Password" b. If the passwords don’t match the newly typed password fields as "Password does not match" c. If the entered password format is wrong as "At least 8 characters that include 1 uppercase, 1 lowercase, 1 special character, 1 number" 4. Update button activates as we type all the information correctly. 5. Success notification as "Password has been changed" appears 6. User is not logged out of the portal. 7. User can also avail the benefit of the forgot password functionality by clicking on the button a. As we hove rover the button, the text changes to blue b. Redirects you to the "Forgot Password" screen
docs.title: Change Password

docs.text: As we click on the button, it logs you out and redirects to the login screen with the same dashboard selected.
docs.title: Logout

docs.text: As we navigate to settings through the side navigating tab, we are redirected to Settings landing page. 1. Language a. By default the language selected be english b. Can translate to spanish or english, will change the the words used in the portal accordingly 2. Time Zone a Will be automatically fetched based on user's location as soon as he enables it. 3. Time Format a. Will be able to select from two types of format b. By default the option selected will be 12 hours 4. Notifications a. Can enable or disable the mail notifications to be sent to admin b. Based on his permission, they will be able to receive mails for two cases i. When a read requests a lumper ii. When lead request for a correction 5. Changes will be saved only when you click on the red save button
docs.title: Settings

docs.text: As we navigate to customers through side navigating tab, we are redirected to it's landing page only for the building the DM is assigned to.
docs.title: Customer

docs.text: The page start with the title Customers and 'i' button which when clicked, gives you an insight of the section, such as to add / edit customer, make them non active or delete, and view their detail page. A red + button to add a customer. Widgets - For selecting the information specific to their status if they are active, non active or both By default the option selected will be "Active and Non Active Customers" Can select more options from the dropdown; Active Customers and Non Active Customers Hierarchy is as shown Search Placeholder for the search bar is "Select Customer in the Selected Type" with a search icon. Based on the filter selected, the data will be only populated for them. For example: If you have selected "Non Active Customers" as a filter and type the name of the customers in the search field. If the customer you are searching for belongs to Non Active, they will appear in the table otherwise "No Results Found" will appear. Active Customers The number of customers who are active appears on the top of table and the associated data will appear in the table. The table consists of followings columns with their title in bold and the information in regular text. Customer Will show the names of the customers. If click on the name, a pop up comes with the following info. If we click on the customer name inside the pop up, it will redirect to the their detail page. Buildings Will show the name of building associated with the customer If click on the name, a pop up comes with the following info. "Multiple" appears if more than one building is associated with the customer, if we click on it, will open a pop up as shown in the image If we click on the building name inside the pop up, it will redirect to the their detail page. Managers & Supervisors Will show the name of managers,supervisor associated with the customer. If click on the name, a pop up comes with the following info. "Count" appears if more than one manager is associated with the customer, if we click on it, will open a pop up as shown in the image. If we click on the manager name inside the pop up, it will redirect to the the customer detail page. Active Since Automatically fetches the date when customer was created. Format of showing date will be "Full month name Date, Year" Action - As we hover over icons, the functionality of them appears in a text form Eye Icon button -> Redirects to their detail page Edit Icon button -> Opens pop up to edit customer details Orange Cross button -> To make a customer non active All Contacts and buildings need to be made Non Active before allowing a Customer Profile to become Non Active. Error message appears when Non Active (orange x) is clicked on a Customer profile that has an active Building and/or Contact. Pagination is implemented which lets you choose how many items to display in a table, by default it's set to 10. Non Active Customers The number of customers who are non active appears on the top of table and the associated data will appear in the table. Hierarchy Order for Non Active Customer is listed by Non Active Since date (reverse chronological order; Present - past) Customer Name (alphabetical order) Same information in tables as for "Active Customers" Non Active Since -> Fetches the date when the customer profile was made non active. Action Green Turn around button -> To reactive the customer Red Cross Button -> To delete a customer; can renter the same information for new profile Delete the profiles from the Customers and Building sections from the listing Delete all its buildings profiles Delete all its contacts profiles Delete Customer (work) Schedules for future dates (for corresponding buildings). Unassign QHL Employees; DM, Leads, and lumpers (from corresponding buildings). Pagination is implemented which lets you choose how many items to display in a table, by default it's set to 10 items per page.
docs.title: Landing page

docs.text: As we click on the red add button, a pop up appears A default profile image appears for the first time. Able to upload the profile image by clicking on the red upload button. Clicking on upload, opens the folder from where you can select the desired image. As you have selected the image, the red "change" button activates which lets you change the image (can reselect the same image too) After a profile image is uploaded, can also remove the picture by clicking on the grey delete icon. As we hover over the deletion icon, it shows the help text " Remove profile photo and return to the default icon" Adding a profile image is not a mandatory field to be filled. Minimum 1 and maximum 50 characters can be added in name field, which accepts alphabets, spaces, numbers and special characters. As you enter the name, red button becomes activated. Cannot enter space as the first character, if added before a name, would discard the spaces entered. If you click on cross button, it shows the pop up to either discard or keep on editing. If you click on discard, it will revert you back to the landing page If you click on continue, it will keep the pop up open
docs.title: Add Customer

docs.text: As we click on the edit icon, a pop up appears A default profile image appears if you haven't uploaded any image. Able to upload or change the profile image by clicking on the red upload button. Clicking on upload, opens the folder from where you can select the desired image. As you have selected the image, the red "change" button activates which lets you change the image (can reselect the same image too) After a profile image is uploaded, can also remove the picture by clicking on the grey delete icon. As we hover over the deletion icon, it shows the help text " Remove profile photo and return to the default icon" Updating a profile image is not a mandatory field to be filled. Minimum 1 and maximum 50 characters can be added in name field, which accepts alphabets, spaces, numbers and special characters. As you enter the name, red update button becomes activated. Changes are saved when you click on the update button for both image & name. Cannot enter space as the first character, if added before a name, would discard the spaces entered. If you click on cross button, it shows the pop up to either discard or keep on editing. If you click on discard, it will revert you back to the landing page If you click on continue, it will keep the pop up open
docs.title: Edit Customer

docs.text: The page start with the title Customers Detail and 'i' button which when clicked, gives you an insight of the section, such as to add/edit contacts, add/edit building, make them non active or delete, and view their detail page. Customer's name and profile picture appears with an edit button A red back button to revert to customer landing page. Widgets For selecting the information specific to their status if they are active, non active or both By default the option selected will be "Active and Non Active" Can select more options from the dropdown; Active and Non Active Active Contacts tab is the selected tab by default with a search bar and count of how many contacts are there as shown in the image Placeholder for the search bar is "Search Contact, Building, Role" with a search icon. If the customer, its associated building or a specific role you are searching is there, will be visible in the table otherwise "No Results Found" will appear. The number of customers who are active appears on the top of table and the associated data will appear in the table. The table consists of followings columns with their title in bold and the information in regular text. Name - Full Name of the contact in alphabetical order Role - Associated role as manager or supervisor will appear for a contact. Hierarchy Order for Role (Managers, Supervisors) Title - Title if you have mentioned any otherwise none will appear Buildings / Permissions - Be able to click on view and a pop up appears for the buildings if he is assigned and has permissions otherwise None will appear Email - Email associated with the contact will appear Phone - Phone no. associated will the contact will appear Active Since Automatically fetches the date when contact was created. Format of showing date will be "Full month name Date, Year" Action - As we hover over icons, the functionality of them appears in a text form Eye Icon button -> Redirects to their detail page Edit Icon button -> Opens pop up to edit customer details Orange Cross button -> To make a customer non active. Contacts for following criteria can be made non active Contacts only assigned to Non Active buildings Contacts who are not assigned to a building. Contacts who have permissions to Active buildings but are not the ‘Main Contacts’ (his names appears in the Edit Building page.) Send Credentials - You can select the contact for which you want to receive email for authorization, as per their account setup Buildings tab is the other tab with a search bar and count of how many buildings are there as shown in the image Placeholder for the search bar is "Search Building, Contact, QHL Employee" with a search icon. Enter the respective name for the information you want to search, its associated data, will be visible in the table otherwise "No Results Found" will appear. The number of customers who are active appears on the top of table and the associated data will appear in the rows. The table consists of followings columns with their title in bold and the information in regular text. Building Name - Full Name of the building Managers / Supervisors - Associated role as manager or supervisor will appear for the building District Manager - Name of the district manager will be shown, when you click on it, the detail pop up opens which redirects you to their detail page Lead - Name of the lead will be shown, when you click on it, the detail pop up opens which redirects you to their detail page Lumper - Name of the Lumper will be shown, when you click on it, the detail pop up opens which redirects you to their detail page Shift Details - Be able to click on view and a pop up appears for the employees as per the shift Active Since Automatically fetches the date when contact was created. Format of showing date will be "Full month name Date, Year" Action - As we hover over icons, the functionality of them appears in a text form Eye Icon button -> Redirects to their detail page Edit Icon button -> Opens pop up to edit buildings details Calendar icon - redirects to the schedule page for the selected building Orange Cross button -> To make a building non active Non Active Contacts tab is the selected tab by default with a search bar and count of how many contacts are there as shown in the image Placeholder for the search bar is "Search Contact, Building, Role" with a search icon. If the customer, its associated building or a specific role you are searching is there, will be visible in the table otherwise "No Results Found" will appear. The number of customers who are active appears on the top of table and the associated data will appear in the table. The table consists of followings columns with their title in bold and the information in regular text. Name - Full Name of the contact Role - Associated role as manager or supervisor will appear for a contact Title - Title if you have mentioned any otherwise none will appear Buildings / Permissions - Be able to click on view and a pop up appears for the buildings if he is assigned and has permissions otherwise None will appear Email - Email associated with the contact will appear Phone - Phone no. associated will the contact will appear Non Active Since Automatically fetches the date when contact was made non active. Format of showing date will be "Full month name Date, Year". Non Active Since date should be listed by reverse chronological order (Present - past) Customer Name (alphabetical order) " - Action - As we hover over icons, the functionality of them appears in a text form - Eye Icon button -> Redirects to their detail page - Edit Icon button -> Opens pop up to edit customer details - Orange Cross button -> To make a customer non active Buildings tab is the other tab with a search bar and count of how many buildings are there as shown in the image Placeholder for the search bar is "Search Building, Contact, QHL Employee" with a search icon. Enter the respective name for the information you want to search, its associated data, will be visible in the table otherwise "No Results Found" will appear. The number of customers who are active appears on the top of table and the associated data will appear in the rows. The table consists of followings columns with their title in bold and the information in regular text. Building Name - Full Name of the building Managers / Supervisors - Associated role as manager or supervisor will appear for the building District Manager - Name of the district manager will be shown, when you click on it, the detail pop up opens which redirects you to their detail page Lead - Name of the lead will be shown, when you click on it, the detail pop up opens which redirects you to their detail page Lumper - Name of the Lumper will be shown, when you click on it, the detail pop up opens which redirects you to their detail page Shift Details - Be able to click on view and a pop up appears for the employees as per the shift -Non Active Since Automatically fetches the date when building was made non active. Format of showing date will be "Full month name, Date, Year" Action - As we hover over icons, the functionality appears in a text form Eye Icon button -> Redirects to their detail page Edit Icon button -> Opens pop up to edit buildings details Green Rotation button -> To make a building active Red Deletion button -> To delete a building
docs.title: Customer Detail Page

docs.text: You can view the form with following fields for entering the information in order to add a contact First Name - A mandatory field Middle Name - not a mandatory field to be filled. Last Name - A mandatory field The minimum and maximum character limits for entering the name would be 1 and 20. Email - A mandatory field, will throw an error when the email entered is not of a proper format. Phone No. - A mandatory 10 digit field, can copy paste a phone no. too. Role - Select a role from managers or supervisors Title - Enter the title respective to the contact you are creating, of minimum 20 characters Shift - A mandatory field to select a shift from all, day, swing and night in the mentioned order Department - not a mandatory field to be filled, by default operations department will be selected. Administrative Permissions Clicking on the edit icon will open section to remove or add permission for a building Can give a contact the permission to either view building details, create schedules or do both for them by clicking on add radio button and selecting the building for which you want Can remove the permission to either view building details, create schedules or both for them by clicking on remove radio button and selecting the building for which you want View current permission - clicking on the button will open a pop up with the buildings and associated permissions When we are creating a contact for the first time If there is no building, then after a building has been created, by default their administrative permissions are updated to view buildings and create schedules for them If a building already exists, we have to give the administrative permissions to the contact Here is the associated email format, when permissions are given or updated Hi [Contact Name], The administrative permissions associated with your QHL's Customer Dashboard account have been updated. New Permissions: View Buildings/Contacts/QHL Employee ID: No Create Work Schedules: No Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics
docs.title: Add Contact

docs.text: All the information for the contact are pre-saved and appears in the field. As you click on the field, you can edit the text as shown in image The update button remains activated even when no changes have been made, clicking on the button, will redirect you to contacts listing with a success notification
docs.title: Edit Contact

docs.text: Clicking on the add building button, will redirect you to the section to add building details as shown in the image. The fields associated while entering the details are as followed Customer To select the name of the customer from the dropdown, all active contacts appear in the dropdown A mandatory field Building Name / Identification Enter the building name you want to associate with a customer Minimum 1 and maximum 20 characters are allowed including, space and numbers as well. Can be same as previous A mandatory field Building Phone Enter the phone number directly or through pasting The country code for a phone number is fixed as +1 and the number should be 10 digits. A mandatory and unique field Building Address Maximum 1 and minimum 50 characters are allowed which includes space, numbers and symbols A mandatory field Zip Code, State & City Minimum 4 & 5 digits of Zip Code can be entered As you enter the correct Zip Code, the state & city associated will be prefilled in their respective fields If the Zip Code entered is incorrect, it will throw you an error that Zip Code doesn't match with our records A mandatory field Manager / Supervisor Once you click on the select, the list of associated contacts with the customers appears You can click on the add new button, to add a contact As you have select the add new button, it open the pop up with role automatically selected depending from where you have selected the option A mandatory field District Manager You can select multiple DM's from the list You cannot select a DM or DM will not appear unless you add a Zip Code DM are appeared in the list when you have added them for the districts If you haven't added any DM associated with the Zip Code you are entering for the building, no DM will appear in the dropdown A mandatory field QHL Office All the saved QHL office will appear in the dropdown A mandatory field Shift detail - As you select a shift, the section expands to save the shift details, which includes [Shift Name] Time - Select from the dropdown the start & end time which ranges from 12am to 11:30pm Department Operations will be selected by default If you select Receiving / shipping as department, lead & lumpers will be separately selected for each department receiving & shipping QHL Lead - Click on the add button, you can search by lead name, and as you increase the distance filter the leads name will start appearing QHL Lumpers - Click on the add button, you can search by lumper name, and as you increase the distance filter the lumpers name will start appearing If no results are found, a message is displayed A mandatory field You can select multiple (all three shifts) or one, depending upon the shifts selected the detail section to include leads & lumpers will appear. Empty Container Report - you can choose whom to send reports when the containers for a schedule are completed as per customize format and the mail frequency By default no will be selected and and when yes is selected, the section expands to set the frequency of email When yes is selected, you can select the contact from the dropdown for which you choose to send the reports As you click on the customize email subject and message, a pop up opens which lets you edit the saved draft of subject and message body You can select the document type to be sent with email from pdf, excel or both You can set the frequency as per the day you want to receive emails. You can either select the work date or can customize the day you want to receive emails By default, 'Monday - Friday' will be selected. As you click on the edit button, a pop up opens which lets you choose from options as selecting specific days and how many weeks. Week period includes options from 1 - 4 You can either select the monthly option, and set the frequency as per the days and the frequency between months. Monthly interval period would range from 1 - 12. Days for the month will have option from all 1st - 31th. Containers Parameter Default container parameters are only 4: Door, Container Number, Cases, Items/Sort Can add additional container parameters by clicking on the add icon as shown in the image The additional container parameter are listed in alphabetical order in both pop up and after selection Can also add a custom parameters, if adding multiple need to separate them with commas Clicking on the add custom parameter field, will save the parameters and they will appear with a checkbox in the pop up, select and save them in order to add the parameters Click on the add building button, information is saved and after a success notification, it redirects you to the buildings listing
docs.title: Add Building

docs.text: As we navigate to buildings through side navigating tab, we are redirected to it's landing page only for the building the DM is assigned to.
docs.title: Buildings

docs.text: The page start with the title buildings and 'i' button which when clicked, gives you an insight of the section, such as to add / edit building and view their detail page. A red + button to add a building. Customer As you enter the name or first alphabet associated with the name, the dropdown is visible with the names that have the same word as you entered. Search Placeholder for the search bar is "Search by building name" with a search icon. Based on the information, the data will be only populated for them. If no data is found, will show "No Results found" State and City As you select a state, then the city filter gets activated and you can select Based on the state selected, the city will be populated Based on the information selected, the data will be only populated for them. If no data is found, will show "No Results found" Active Buildings Beside the title, the counter is also displayed for the number of buildings that are active The table would have following columns Building - will include the building name Customer - Will have the associated customers name City / State - Associated with the buildings Managers / Supervisors - Contact who are associated with the buildings Leads / Lumpers - Employees (Leads & Lumpers) who are associated with the buildings Shift Details - As we click on the pop up, the employees who are associated with the building will appear "Count" appears if more than one contact is associated with the customer, if we click on it, will open a pop up as shown in the image. As we click on the names, a pop up opens with the personal details and as we click on it, it redirects to their detail page Pagination is implemented which lets you choose how many items to display in a table, by default it's set to 10.

docs.title: Add Building

docs.text: All the information for the building are pre-saved and appears in the field. As you click on the field, you can edit the text as shown in image. The update button remains activated even when no changes have been made, clicking on the button, will redirect you to buildings listing with a success notification.
docs.title: Edit Building

docs.text: The buildings details can be viewed by clicking on the eye icon as shown in the image. . A back button which redirects you to the listing of buildings. An edit icon which lets you edit building details. The building name appears on the top of the page with the address including state, city and Zip Code. Associated phone no. for the building appears under the building phone title Customer name appears under the Customer title for the associated building Created By - Full name of the person who created the building appears on the page, can be a DM or Admin Created On - Automatically fetches the day it was created. Customer Contact - This section displays information with respect to the contact and their permissions If only one person is there as manager/supervisor then their name appears. Clicking on the name would open a pop up and then clicking on the name would redirect you to detail page. If more than one person is associated with the building multiple appears. Clicking on the multiple would open the pop up which will show all the names of the contacts with their details Administrative Permissions Clicking on the multiple will open the permissions pop up associated with the contacts selected for the building District Manager - Name of the associated QHL DM will appear under the section Admin Office - Name of the associated QHL Office will appear under the section Shift detail - The associated shift details will appear under shift time and day If multiple shifts are selected, they will appear in the detail page with their time and team details as shown in image with lead and lumpers personal details If the department selected is receiving/shipping then their team details would appear separately Empty Container Report If the email report is selected as no, then the expanded section would not appear If the email report is selected as yes, then the expanded section would appear with following information Email Recipient will have name of the contact you have you have selected who would receive the email with the document Email Subject and Message - Clicking on the view button, would open the pop up that which contains the email subject and email body. Document Type - Would show the type you have chosen Repeat - Will show the frequency you have selected for sending the email with starting date and email specific time Container Parameters Parameters - All the associated parameters will appear in alphabetical order Default parameters will appear in the same order as during adding
docs.title: Building Detail Page

docs.text: As we navigate to employees through side navigating tab, we are redirected to it's landing page. All employees are visible including his own(teh logged in)
docs.title: Employees

docs.text: The page start with the title employees and 'i' button which when clicked, gives you an insight of the section, such as to add / edit employee and view their detail page. A red + button to add a employees. Widgets Active and Non Active Employees For selecting the information specific to their status if they are active, non active or both By default the option selected will be "Active and Non Active Employees" Can select more options from the dropdown; Active Employees and Non Active Employees Based on the filter selected, only those employees will appear or else will show "No Results Found". Role Have three type of employees roles that appear in the dropdown, can revert to the role Based on the filter selected, only those employees will appear or else will show "No Results Found". Assigned All Building name appears in the dropdown You can select a none option to see who are the employees who are not assigned to any building State / City As you select a state, then the city filter gets activated and you can select Based on the state selected, the city will be populated Based on the information selected, the data will be only populated for them. If no data is found, will show "No Results found" Search Customers Placeholder for the search bar is "Customer". As you type the respective associated name will start appearing the dropdown. Based on the filters selected, data will be populated for them All Buildings Placeholder for the search bar is "All Buildings". As you type the respective associated name will start appearing the dropdown. Based on the filters selected, data will be populated for them Employees Placeholder for the search bar is "Search Employees in the Selected Type" with a search icon. Based on the filter selected, the data will be only populated for them. For example: If you have selected "Non Active Employees" as a filter and type the employee name in the search field. If it belongs to Non Active, they will appear in the table otherwise "No Results Found" will appear. Active Employees The number of employees who are active appears on the top of table and the associated data will appear in the table. The table consists of followings columns with their title in bold and the information in regular text. Name Will show the names of the employees. If click on the name, a pop up comes with the following info. If we click on the employee name inside the pop up, it will redirect to the their detail page. Assigned Will show the name of building associated with the employee If click on the name, a pop up comes with the following info. "Multiple" appears if more than one building is associated with the employee, if we click on it, will open a pop up. If we click on the building name inside the pop up, it will redirect to the their detail page. ID - Unique ID associated with employee will appear Phone - Unique phone number associated with employee will appear Email - Unique email associated with employee will appear Residence - State and city with respect to the building address will appear Active Since Automatically fetches the date when employee was created. Format of showing date will be "Full month name, Date, Year" Action - As we hover over icons, the functionality of them appears in a text form Eye Icon button -> Redirects to their detail page Edit Icon button -> Opens pop up to edit customer details Orange Cross button -> To make a employee non active Employees need to be unassigned in order to make them Non Active. Error message appears when Non Active (orange x) is clicked for employee that is assigned to a building Send credentials button appears for DM and Lead profile, an email is send with respect to their status if the employee has already verify email and set-up a password. If employee has NOT verified email and set-up a password, then send Email Verification and Password Set-Up If employee verify email but has not set-up a password, then send 'Set Password' email If a employee has already verified email and set-up a password, then send a 'Reset Password' email When clicked on ID button, ID pop uos gets open up which can be further generated Pagination is implemented which lets you choose how many items to display in a table, by default it's set to 10. Non Active Employees The number of employees who are non active appears on the top of table and the associated data will appear in the table. Hierarchy Order for Non Active Customer is listed by Non Active Since date (reverse chronological order; Present - past) Customer Name (alphabetical order) Same information in tables as for "Active Employees" Non Active Since -> Fetches the date when the customer profile was made non active. Action Green Turn around button -> To make the employee active Red Cross Button -> To delete a employee; can renter the same information for new profile Pagination is implemented which lets you choose how many items to display in a table, by default it's set to 10 items per page.
docs.title: Landing page

docs.text: You can view the form with following fields for entering the information in order to add an employee. First Name - A mandatory field Middle Name - not a mandatory field to be filled.
