Last Name - A mandatory field The minimum and maximum character limits for entering the name would be 1 and 20. Email - A mandatory unique field, will throw an error when the email entered is not of a proper format. Phone No. - A mandatory 10 digit unique field, can copy paste a phone no. too. Address - Residential address of the employee. Maximum 1 and minimum 50 characters are allowed which includes space, numbers and symbols A mandatory field Zip Code, State & City Minimum 4 & 5 digits of Zip Code can be entered As you enter the correct Zip Code, the staTe & city associated will be prefilled in their respective fields If the Zip Code entered is incorrect, it will throw you an error that Zip Code doesn't match with our records. Foe eg: 07041 is considered as an incorrect Zip Code A mandatory field Preferred Contact Method You can select your preferable mode from phone (as text message), through email or both in order to receive updates By default, email will be selected Work Identification - Employee ID - A unique 7 digit employee ID will be generated for every employee which is a combination of three alphabets and four numbers. A mandatory field Role - Can select a role from District Manager, Lead and Lumper. A mandatory field Title - Enter the title respective to the employee you are creating, of minimum 20 characters. Job Description - You can create a detail description related to the role you have selected. Work Availability Availability By default, full time will be selected by default. Can select from either full time or part time Shift Availability By default, day will be selected as the default shift A mandatory field to select a shift from all, day, swing and night in the mentioned order Can only select only one field Availability Notes Can create a detail description related to the role you have selected. Travel Details Ability to travel between buildings By default, no would be selected by default If you have selected no and yes, then based on the selection, they will appear in the building and for the requests for a lumper or assigned them as temporary Miles Radius from primary building / Residence If yes has been selected, you can enter the miles up to 60 It is used when we want to filter the employees based on their distance while adding to the building Travel Notes Can create a detail description related from the travel perspective you have selected Miscellaneous Date Hired - Can select from previous and today's date Notes - Can create a detail description related to the employee profile you have selected As you click on add, the changes are saved and redirects you to the listing page. Based on the role you have selected, you'll receive following emails of information regarding your account creation and setup. Here is the associated email format, when DM profile is created "Hi [DM's First Name], Congratulations. Your QHL account has been created. Click here to verify email and create a password *Link expires in 48 hours. After you set-up your password, you'll be able to sign into the QHL's Admin Dashboard to see information for your buildings. (Admin Portal website link will be place here as a hyperlink). Please contact your QHL Office, if you have any questions or need help. Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics" Here is the associated email format, when Lead profile is created "Hi [Lead's First Name], Congratulations. Your QHL account has been created. Click here to activate your account and set a password *Link expires in 48 hours. After you activate your account , you'll be able to sign into the QHL's mobile app to manage work information for your QHL team. Please contact your QHL District Manager, if you have any questions or need help. Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics" Here is the associated email format, when Lumper profile is created "From: QHL Support Subject: Account Created ---- Hello [Lumper's first Name], Your account with QHL has been created. You will be receiving work notifications by [Preferred Contact Method]. Speak with your QHL District Manager if you would like to change to a different method. Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics" Here is the associated email format, when employee profile is created " From: QHL Support Subject: Account Updated ---- Hello [Employee's first Name], Your account has been updated. Updated [Role/Phone/Email/Address]: Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics"
docs.title: Add Employee

docs.text: All the information for the employee are pre-saved and appears in the field. As you click on the field, you can edit the text as shown in image. The update button remains disabled even when no changes have been made, clicking on the button, will redirect you to employees listing with a success notification. Email are sent across when the following are updated Email, Role, Phone, Email and address are changed Here is the associated email format, when employee profile is created " From: QHL Support Subject: Account Updated ---- Hello [Employee's first Name], Your account has been updated. Updated [Role/Phone/Email/Address]: Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics"
docs.title: Edit Employee

docs.text: The employee details can be viewed by clicking on the eye icon as shown in the image . A back button which redirects you to the listing of buildings. An edit icon which lets you edit building details. The employee name appears on the top of the page with the email address, phone, residential address (including state, city and Zip Code) and proffered contact Method Work Identification Unique employee ID will appear Role selected will appear If Title and description have information, their information will appear otherwise it would be blank Work Availability Availability - The availability selected will appear Shift Availability - The shift selected will appear If Availability notes have information, then it will appear otherwise it would be blank Travel Details Ability to travel between buildings - the option you have selected will appear If you have selected no, the the blank information will appear for the rest of the fields If you have selected yes, the respectively information will appear for Miles radius and travel notes Miscellaneous Date hired & notes will appear in the this section Assigned Customer and building details for whom the employee is assigned to.
docs.title: Employee Detail Page

docs.text: As we navigate to QHL Office through side navigating tab, we are redirected to it's landing page information appears only for the building the DM is assigned to
docs.title: QHL Office

docs.text: The page start with the title QHL Office and 'i' button which when clicked, gives you an insight of the section. A red + button to add a QHL Office. Widgets State / City As you select a state, then the city filter gets activated and you can select Based on the state selected, the city will be populated Based on the information selected, the data will be only populated for them. If no data is found, will show "No Results found" Search - A single search bar which throws result for the below two functions. Placeholder for the search bar is "Search Office or Building" with a search icon. Office As you type the respective associated office name, information will start appearing in the table. Search function overwrites the filters. All Buildings As you type the respective associated information regarding the entered building name will start appearing in the table. Search function overwrites the filters. The table consists of followings columns with their title in bold and the information in regular text. Name Will show the names of the QHL Office. Minimum and maximum character limit are 1 and 20. Address - Residential address of the employee. Maximum 1 and minimum 50 characters are allowed which includes space, numbers and symbols Hours - Open and close hours will appear within the range Email - A mandatory unique field, will throw an error when the email entered is not of a proper format. Phone No. - A mandatory 10 digit field, can copy paste a phone no. too. Assigned Will show the name of building associated with the qhl office If click on the name, a pop up comes with the information about buildings "Multiple" appears if more than one building is associated with the employee, if we click on it, will open a pop up as shown int he image If we click on the building name inside the pop up, it will redirect to the their detail page. Active Since Automatically fetches the date when QHL Office was created. Format of showing date will be "Full month name, Date, Year" Action - As we hover over icons, the functionality of them appears in a text form Edit Icon button -> Opens pop up to edit customer details Red Cross button To delete a qhl office The delete button is disabled when a qhl office is assigned to a building Pagination is implemented which lets you choose how many items to display in a table, by default it's set to 10 items per page.
docs.title: Landing page

docs.text: You can view the form with following mandatory fields for entering the information in order to add a QHL Office. Name The minimum and maximum character limits for entering the name would be 1 and 20. Address - Residential address of the office. Maximum 1 and minimum 50 characters are allowed which includes space, numbers and symbols Email - A field, will throw an error when the email entered is not of a proper format. Phone No. - A 10 digit field, can copy paste a phone no. too. State, City and Zip Code As you enter the state and city, the associated Zip Code will be prefilled in its respective field. Open Time and Close Time The dropdown in close time appears with the filtered time range as per your selection in open time
docs.title: Add QHL Office

docs.text: All the information for the QHL Office are pre-saved and appears in the field. As you click on the field, you can edit the text as shown in image. The update button remains enabled even when no changes have been made, clicking on the update office button, will redirect you to qhl office listing with a success notification.
docs.title: Edit QHL Office

docs.text: The page start with the title Districts and 'i' button which when clicked, gives you an insight of the section, such as to add / edit a district and take actions only for the building the DM is assigned to. A red + button to add a district. Widgets Active and Non Active Districts For selecting the information specific to their status if they are active, non active or both By default the option selected will be "Active and Non Active Districts" Can select more options from the dropdown; Active Districts and Non Active Districts Based on the filter selected, only those Districts will appear or else will show "No Results Found". State / City As you select a state, then the city filter gets activated and you can select Based on the state selected, the city will be populated Based on the information selected, the data will be only populated for them. If no data is found, will show "No Results found" Search - A single search bar which throws result for the below three functions. Placeholder for the search bar is "Search by State, City or District Manager" with a search icon. State or city As you type the state or city, information will start appearing in the table. Search function overwrites the filters. District Manager As you type the DM name, information will start appearing in the table. Search function overwrites the filters. Active Districts - The table consists of followings columns with their title in bold and the information in regular text. State - Name of the state City - Name of the city District Manager - Name of the district managers who are assigned to the district Action Edit Icon button -> Opens pop up to edit district Orange Cross button -> To make a district non active Red cross icon - To delete a district Pagination is implemented which lets you choose how many items to display in a table, by default it's set to 10 items per page. Non Active Districts - The table consists of followings columns with their title in bold and the information in regular text. State - Name of the state City - Name of the city District Manager - Name of the district managers who are assigned to the district Action Green round button -> To make a district active Pagination is implemented which lets you choose how many items to display in a table, by default it's set to 10 items per page.
docs.title: Landing page

docs.text: By clicking on the button, you will be redirected to the pop up as shown in the image. Once you select a state, city field will start to appear. For selecting a District Manager, name of the employee whose role is DM will start appearing You can select one or multiple from the dropdown and click okay You should be able to add a DM to any District regardless of his address (Residence) You should be able to add a DM to multiple Districts. You should be able to have multiple DM's to the same District. If the district already exist it will throw an error to use Edit action. Click on add will add the districts and redirect you to listing page
docs.title: Add Districts

docs.text: All the information for the districts are pre-saved and appears in the field. As you click on the field, you can edit based on the following circumstances If a district (State or City) to be edited has a DM assigned to a building in the current district State and City fields are grey- out and disable. when State or City fields are clicked, have a popup message appear "Cannot Edit District. A DM is assigned to a building." DM cannot be unchecked (unassigned) from a district if he is assigned to a building in the current district. DM field is Grey- out and disable check-mark When check-mark is clicked, have popup message appear. "Cannot unassigned DM. DM is assigned to a building in this District." Update button remains disable until a information has been edited " The update button remains enabled even when no changes have been made, clicking on the update office button, will redirect you to qhl office listing with a success notification.
docs.title: Edit Districts

docs.text: You can view the landing page only for the building the DM is assigned to in two views; list view & calendar view. When there are no schedules(current and upcoming) active in a month including, the information on landing shows no records for both kind of view as seen in the image As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page. For showing the total customers, employees and buildings on the admin portal through three cards. Section is divided into today, next week and remaining months schedules (which include the next three week) Table for each section include the same columns as follows Work date - The day on which the work to be performed for the schedule Building Name - For whom the work is scheduled for Shift - Building's shift Department - Buildings' department Container Type - Type and quantity of containers scheduled Total Containers - Total quantity of containers scheduled Created by - Name of the person who created either customer's contact(managers & supervisors) or lead for the building appears Status - Various types of following status appears for the scheduled Scheduled - When the schedule has been created and work has not started. Color code is light blue Signed - When customer signs customer sheet, it depicts the work has been completed. Color code is dark blue Overdue- When the scheduled work shift and customer has not signed the customer sheet. Color code is orange. In Progress - When lumpers starts to work on the first scheduled container. Completed - When all schedules are in complete status Cancelled - When not all containers are given a complete status Terminated - When a schedule has been cancelled by the contact or lead Unfinished - Has a container that has to be resumed in future Action Live Details - As you click on the red network button, you'll be redirected to page where you can view live updates for the current day of a schedule Schedule Details - As you click on the eye button, you'll be redirected to the schedules details page Calendar View total containers for a building are visible for each day with a combination of all shifts & departments. When you click on the card for a following, pop up appears with the scheduled information Can switch between month to see the future schedules
docs.title: Landing Page

docs.text: Live details of the schedule as the container status's keep on updating Appears for only the current active day of the schedule A informative section of the building appears on top which consists of the building name, address, Manager & supervisor's name, work date, shift and it's time, department, main lead with the work schedule status A section appears for the container status, how many are scheduled and the count under each status For each container type; a separate section is presented followed by it's detail. The hierarchy followed for this is Outbound, live load and drop The column in the table is as followed Scheduled - The status of the container Fixed container parameters appears which are followed in the listed hierarchy Door, Container Number, Cases, Items/Sort After The fixed containers, additional or customer parameters if any will appear in the columns Worker - Who all worked on the container Start Time - Of the schedule End Time - of the schedule Status - of the container Scheduled Notes If there any notes associated, the button will turn blue and if not then grey As you click on the pop up, the saved note appears. The pop up includes the notes for customer and QHL entered by the lead.
docs.title: Work progress

docs.text: You can view the landing page in two views; list view & calendar view. When there are no schedules(current and upcoming) active in a month shows no records for both kind of view as seen in the image. only for the building the DM is assigned to. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page. Search - A single search bar which throws result for the below two functions. Placeholder for the search bar is "Search Building Name" with a search icon. All Buildings As you type the respective associated information regarding the entered building name will start appearing in the table. Search function overwrites the filters. Widgets Shift - Can select the shifts from the dropdown Created By - Name of the person who has created the schedule appears in the dropdown Status - Can filter via status All Dates - Can search via specific schedule through their work date Table for each section include the same columns as follows Building Name - For whom the work is scheduled for Shift - Building's shift Duration - The duration, custom, weekly or monthly, represented in a date form Total Days - The total for which the schedule is created for Container Type / Duration - Type and quantity of containers scheduled Total Containers / Duration - Total quantity of containers scheduled Created by - Name of the person who created either customer's contact(managers & supervisors) or lead for the building appears Status - Various types of following status appears for the scheduled Scheduled - When the schedule has been created and work has not started. Color code is light blue Signed - When customer signs customer sheet, it depicts the work has been completed. Color code is dark blue Overdue- When the scheduled work shift and customer has not signed the customer sheet. Color code is orange. In Progress - When lumpers starts to work on the first scheduled container. Action Notes - As you click on the button, a pop up open to view the details of the scheduled notes. If there any notes associated, the button will turn blue and if not then grey Schedule Details - As you click on the eye button, you'll be redirected to the schedules details page A schedule automatically moves to non active after the work date has been passed or terminated Calendar View total containers for a building are visible for each day with a combination of all shifts & departments. When you click on the card for a following, pop up appears with the scheduled information Can switch between month to see the future schedules
docs.title: Landing Page

docs.text: Appears for only the upcoming schedules in a month . Include following details A informative section of the building appears which consists of the building name, address,Manager & supervisor's name, work date, shift and it's time, department, main lead, total scheduled containers with the status For each container type; a separate section is presented followed by it's detail. The hierarchy followed for this is Outbound The column in the table is as followed Origin - The status of the container Start Time - Of the schedule Scheduled On - the date it was scheduled Duration - Based on custom, weekly or monthly Created By - By whom it was created Role - Role of the person who created Status - Status of the container Scheduled Notes If there any notes associated, the button will turn blue and if not then grey As you click on the pop up, the saved note appears.
docs.title: Schedule Detail Page

docs.text: As the assigned employee (lead & lumper) clocks into the portal to start work on the schedule, their attendance appears in this section. Can view information only for the building the DM is assigned to. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page. A report button appears on the top which will redirect you to report item selection page. Search All Buildings Placeholder for the search bar is "All Buildings". As you type the respective associated name will start appearing the dropdown. Based on the filters selected, data will be populated for them Employees Placeholder for the search bar is "Search by Lumper name" with a search icon. Based on the filter selected, the data will be only populated for them. All Dates - Can search via specific schedule through their work date Widgets Shift - All departments appear in the dropdown Department - All departments appear in the dropdown Clocked Out - Two status appears in the dropdown for the employee if he has clocked out or not Signature - If the customer sheet has been signed, based on it two status appears which are signed and pending Landing Page - Table for each section include the same columns as follows Date - The day the person has logged into the portal through mobile application Building - Name of the building for whom the work is scheduled for Name - Name of the employee for which the attendance is clocked in for Role - The role of the clocked in employee Shift - The abbreviation for the shifts Department - The abbreviation for the department Clocked In - When he clocks into the portal Clocked Out - When he clocks out of the portal Total time - calculated between the clock in & clock out time Lunch Start - Time when lunch break started Lunch end - Time when lunch break was end Total Lunch - calculated between the lunch start & lunch end time Reg Time Work Time OT DOT Signature Pending - When the customer hasn't signed the sheet Signed - When the customer has signed the sheet Note- If the notes were saved while adding the attendance will appear in and the button will turn blue or else grey
docs.title: Time Clock

docs.text: When there are no customer sheet submitted by lead for a building's schedule. The information in table appears as blank with no records as seen in the image. Can view only for the building the DM is assigned to. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing customer sheet report or generate it. Report Button - Appears on right side which redirects the user for generating the report Search - search bars which throws result for the below two functions. All Buildings As you type the respective associated information regarding the entered building name will start appearing in the dropdown. If no data is available then no records will be shown Search function overwrites the filters. Search Customer As you type the respective associated information regarding the entered building name will start appearing in the dropdown. If no data is available then no records will be shown Search function overwrites the filters. Search Customer, Building, Representative or QHL Lead Search through the name of lead and lumpers that are temporarily scheduled, results will start populating in the table By representative it will search that lead has saved when signing up for customer details to submit a customer sheet If no information is available, then no records will be shown All Dates - Can search via specific schedule through their work date Widgets Shift - Can select the shifts from the dropdown Department - can select departments from the dropdown Signature Signed - Signed customer sheet when signed and submitted by lead Pending - Pending customer sheet The table consists of following columns: Date - The customer sheet was signed Customer - Associated customer name appears for the respective building's schedule Building - Associated building name appears for the schedule Shift - Building's shift appears Department - Building's department appears Lead - Assigned main lead name appears Not Completed - Counter of the containers appears which are in not completed status. If no containers have not completed status then 0 appears Cancelled - Counter of the containers appears which are in cancelled status. If no containers have not cancelled status then 0 appears Completed - Counter of the containers appears which are in completed status. If no containers have completed status then 0 appears Signature Status fo signed or pending appears When clicked on the signed button, opens pop up to show the representative name & signature Action Note When notes are saved while submitting the sheet. Button turn blue and when clicked upon opens a pop up to show the saved note If no notes are saved, button turns grey and is disable Eye Icon - To view customer sheet detail page
docs.title: Customer Sheet

docs.text: As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing customer sheet report or generate it. Report Button - Appears on right side which redirects the user for generating the report The page is divided into separate section which includes the building details with ready to export functionality and for the container type details The first section - Building details consists of Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button Generate button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report Building details which includes Building Name - with the complete address Work date - Complete day of work with the day, month date, year. Does not consists of abbreviations for months Customer Name Shift - Shift of the building Representative Name - the name lead fills up while submitting the customer sheet Manager - Name of the manager Shift Time - When we create a building, the time for the shift appears Signature - Uploaded signature will appear when lead submitted the customer sheet Supervisor - Name of the supervisor Department - full name of the department appears Representative Notes - Which were entered while submitting the customer sheet Lead - Name of the lead appears Not completed - Counter of the Unfinished & not open containers which comes under this status. Cancelled - Counter of the container which comes under this status Completed - Counter of the container which comes under this status The next section include container type with following hierarchy outbound, live load, drop with total count on each section if available. The following column appear for the container type Origin - by whom it was added Fixed container parameters appears which are followed in the listed hierarchy Door, Container Number, Cases, Items/Sort After The fixed containers, additional or customer parameters if any will appear in the columns Status Cancelled - When the container has been moved to cancel state. Can move before or after the work done has been completed Completed - When the container has been moved to complete state. All work done has to be completed Unfinished - When the container has been moved to unfinished state, has work remaining to be done. Remaining work is scheduled to be completed in upcoming days Not Open - When the container has been moved to Not open state. Can move before or after all the work done has been completed Lumper Note As you click on the button, a pop up open to view the details of the scheduled notes If there any notes associated, the button will turn blue and if not then grey For completed, only lumper note for customer will appear For Cancelled & not open, only group note will appear For unfinished, both group note & lumper note for customer will appear
docs.title: Customer Sheet Detail

docs.text: As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing customer sheet report or generate it. The page is divided into separate section which includes the selection section and the associated filtered results 1. The first includes the selection of building through the following - Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button - Generate & generate summary button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) - View button would redirect to the detail page - Buttons will be activate once you select the desired building or tab - Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report - Select customer by entering the name, related information will appear in the dropdown. select the desired from the dropdown - Select desired state & city - Select teh desired building from the dropdown. Buildings appear based on the above filters applied - Select the desired shift & departments - Select the date range (start & end) from the calendar pop up - By default, the current date appears - Start & End date cannot be same 2. As per the selected filters, information starts to appear in the next section which is again divided into two tabs. If no information is available, no records found message appears - First Tab - Select Building - All available shifts & departments will appear - The following columns appear - Customer - Name of the customer will appear - Building - building name will appear - Shift - shift name will appear - Department - department name will appear - Leads - Lead name will appear - You can either select any particular row or can select all - Second Tab - select shift / department - Can select specific shift or departments for buildings - - The following columns appear - Customer - Name of the customer will appear - Building - building name will appear - Shift - shift name will appear - Department - department name will appear - Leads - Lead name will appear - You can either select any particular row or can select all 3. Hierarchy Order for listing is as followed - Customer Name (alphabetical order) - Building Name (alphabetical order) - Shift (Day, Swing, Night) - Department (Operations, Receiving, Shipping)
docs.title: Customer Sheet Report: Item Selection

docs.text: When there are no lumpers sheet submitted by lead for a building's schedule. The information in table appears as blank with no records as seen in the image. Can view only for the building the DM is assigned to. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing lumper sheet report or generate it. Report Button - Appears on right side which redirects the user for generating the report Search - search bar which throws result for the below two functions. All Buildings As you type the respective associated information regarding the entered building name will start appearing in the table. If no data is available then no records will be shown Search function overwrites the filters. Search by Customer, Building, QHL Lead or Lumper Search through the name of lead and lumpers that are temporarily scheduled, results will start populating in the table If no information is available, then no records will be shown All Dates - Can search via specific schedule through their work date Widgets Shift - Can select the shifts from the dropdown Department - can select departments from the dropdown The table consists of following columns: Date - The lumper sheet was signed Customer - Associated customer name appears for the respective building's schedule Building - Associated building name appears for the schedule Shift - Building's shift appears Department - Building's department appears Lead - Assigned main lead name appears Not Completed - Counter of the containers appears which are in not completed status. If no containers have not completed status then 0 appears Cancelled - Counter of the containers appears which are in cancelled status. If no containers have not cancelled status then 0 appears Work Completed - Counter of the containers appears which are in completed status. If no containers have completed status then 0 appears Count only appears when customer sheet has been signed Worker Count of the numbers of worked who were scheduled to work on containers When clicked on the number, opens a pop up to show information of the employee( lead & lumper) who worked Action Eye Icon - To view lumper sheet detail page
docs.title: Lumper Sheet

docs.text: As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing lumper sheet report or generate it. Report Button - Appears on right side which redirects the user for generating the report The page is divided into separate section which includes the building details with ready to export functionality and for the container type details The first section - Building details consists of Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button Generate button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report Building details which includes Building Name - with the complete address Work date - Complete day of work with the day, month date, year. Does not consists of abbreviations for months Customer Name Shift - Shift of the building Shift Time - When we create a building, the time for the shift appears Manager - Name of the manager Department - full name of the department appears Supervisor - Name of the supervisor Lead - Name of the lead appears Containers Unfinished - completed - Counter of the Unfinished & not open containers which comes under this status. Containers Completed - Count of the container which comes under this status "complete" Workers - Count of workers (lead & lumper). Includes requested & temporary too The next section include container type with following hierarchy completed & unfinished with employee name(lead, lumper, requested lumper & temporary lumper), ID and Role(for temporary & requested [T] & [R] appears). The following column appears. Status - Only complete & unfinished appear Type - Type of container is stated Door - Information added by lead for entering container parameters Container - Information added by lead for entering container parameters Cases - Information added by lead for entering container parameters Items/Sort - Information added by lead for entering container parameters Additional parameters - Information added by lead for entering additional container parameters Start time - start time entered for the scheduled lumper End Time - start time entered for the scheduled lumper Total Time - total time is calculated based on the start & end time Total Pause - pause time entered for the scheduled lumpers. If lead hasn't filled then 0 appears Waiting time - waiting time entered for the scheduled lumpers. If lead hasn't filled then 0 appears Work Done If work done is less than 100%, a pop up opens which shows the details of who worked based on percentage. The info should add up to 100% Lumper Notes As you click on the button, a pop up open to view the details of the scheduled notes If there any notes associated, the button will turn blue and if not then grey For completed, only lumper note for customer will appear For unfinished, both group note & lumper note for customer will appear
docs.title: Lumper Sheet Report - View

docs.text: As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing lumper sheet report or generate it. The page is divided into separate section which includes the selection section and the associated filtered results 1. The first includes the selection of building through the following - Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button - Generate & generate summary button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) - View button would redirect to the detail page - Buttons will be activate once you select the desired row on tab - Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report - Select customer by entering the name, related information will appear in the dropdown. select the desired from the dropdown - Select desired state & city - Select the desired building from the dropdown. Buildings appear based on the above filters applied - Select the desired shift & departments - Select the date range (start & end) from the calendar pop up - By default, the current date appears - Start & End date can be same 2. As per the selected filters, information starts to appear in the next section which is again divided into three tabs. If no information is available, no records found message appears - First Tab - Select Building - All available shifts & departments will appear - The following columns appear - Customer - Name of the customer will appear - Building - building name will appear - Shift - shift name will appear - Department - department name will appear - Leads - Lead name will appear - You can either select any particular row or can select all - Second Tab - select shift / department - Can select specific shift or departments for buildings - The following columns appear - Customer - Name of the customer will appear - Building - building name will appear - Shift - shift name will appear - Department - department name will appear - Leads - Lead name will appear - You can either select any particular row or can select all - Third Tab - Select worker - Shows the employee information who have worked on the containers - The following columns appear - Name - Name of the employee will appear - Role - Lead & lumper will appear - For temporary & requested [T] & [R] appears with their role - Customer - Name of the customer will appear - Building - building name will appear - Shift - shift name will appear - Department - department name will appear - You can either select any particular row or can select all 3. Hierarchy order for listing within each column is as followed - Customer (alphabetical) - Building (alphabetical) - Shift (Day, Swing, Night) - Department (Operations, Receiving, Shipping) - Leads (alphabetical order) - Lumpers (alphabetical order) - role (lead, Lumpers) - name (alphabetical order)
docs.title: Lumper Sheet Report: Item Selection

docs.text: As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page for whom you can download and view the report. Work reports for the following section appears which includes their detail page and ability to generate reports when clicked Dashboard Schedules Time Clock Lumper Sheet Customer Sheet Empty Container Customers Employees
docs.title: Landing Page

docs.text: As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing dashboard schedule report or generate it. The page is divided into separate section which includes the selection section and the associated filtered results The first includes the selection of building Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button Generate & generate summary button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) View button would redirect to the detail page Buttons will be activate once you select the desired row on tab Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report Select the date range (start & end) from the calendar pop up By default, the current date appears Start & End date can be same As per the selected filters, information starts to appear in the next section which is again divided into three tabs. If no information is available, no records found message appears First Tab - Container Per Day The informative message appears The following columns appear before the table starts Building - building name will appear Shift - shift name will appear Department - department name will appear Leads - Lead name will appear Second Tab - Container per shift / department Can select specific shift or departments for buildings The informative message appear before the table starts The following columns appear Building - building name will appear Shift - shift name will appear Department - department name will appear Leads - Lead name will appear You can either select any particular row or can select all
docs.title: Dashboard Schedule Report: Item Selection

docs.text: As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing dashboard schedules report or generate it. The page is divided into separate section which includes the building details with ready to export functionality and for the container type details The first section - Building details consists of Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button Generate button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report Building details which includes Building Name - with the complete address Customer Name Shift - Shift of the building Manager - Name of the manager Department - full name of the department appears Supervisor - Name of the supervisor Reports Date Range - The selected date range will appear in month, date & year format The next section includes the various dates as per the range selected. The following column appears. Shift - Shift of the building Department - full name of the department appears Lead - Name of the lead appears Container Type - Type of container is stated in abbreviated with their count Total Container - Count of total containers appear Created By - Name of the person created a schedule
docs.title: Dashboard Schedules Report: View

docs.text: As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing time clock sheet report or generate it. The page is divided into separate section which includes the selection section and the associated filtered results The first includes the selection of building through the following Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button Generate & generate summary button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) View button would redirect to the detail page Buttons will be activate once you select the desired row on tab Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report Select customer from the dropdown. Select desired state & city Select the desired building from the dropdown. Buildings appear based on the above filters applied Select the desired shift & departments Select the date range (start & end) from the calendar pop up By default, the current date appears Start & End date can be same As per the selected filters, information starts to appear in the next section which is again divided into three tabs. If no information is available, no records found message appears First Tab - Select Building - All available shifts & departments will appear The following columns appear Customer - Name of the customer will appear Building - building name will appear Shift - shift name will appear Department - department name will appear Leads - Lead name will appear You can either select any particular row or can select all Second Tab - select shift / department - Can select specific shift or departments for buildings The following columns appear Customer - Name of the customer will appear Building - building name will appear Shift - shift name will appear Department - department name will appear Leads - Lead name will appear You can either select any particular row or can select all Third Tab - Select worker - Shows the employee information who have worked on the containers The following columns appear Name - Name of the employee will appear Role Lead & lumper will appear For temporary & requested [T] & [R] appears with their role Customer - Name of the customer will appear Building - building name will appear Shift - shift name will appear Department - department name will appear You can either select any particular row or can select all Hierarchy order for listing within each column is as followed Customer (alphabetical) Building (alphabetical) Shift (Day, Swing, Night) Department (Operations, Receiving, Shipping) Leads (alphabetical order) Lumpers (alphabetical order)
docs.title: Time Clock Report: Item Selection

docs.text: As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing time clock report or generate it. The page is divided into separate section which includes the building details with ready to export functionality and for the container type details The first section - Building details consists of Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button Generate button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report Building details which includes Building Name - with the complete address Customer Name Manager - Name of the manager Supervisor - Name of the supervisor Shift - Shift of the building Shift Time - When we create a building, the time for the shift appears Department - full name of the department appears Reports Date Range - The selected date range will appear in month, date & year format The next section includes the various dates as per the range selected. The following column appears. Name - Name of the employee for which the attendance is clocked in for ID - Employee Id is shown Role - The role of the clocked in employee Clocked In - When he clocks into the portal Clocked Out - When he clocks out of the portal Total time - calculated between the clock in & clock out time Lunch Start - Time when lunch break started Lunch end - Time when lunch break was end Total Lunch - calculated between the lunch start & lunch end time Reg Time Work Time OT DOT Signature Pending - When the customer hasn't signed the lumper sheet Signed - When the customer has signed the lumper sheet Note - If the notes were saved while adding the attendance will appear in and the button will turn blue or else grey If no information is there for time then -- appears Hierarchy order for listing within each column is as followed role (lead, Lumpers) name (alphabetical order)
docs.title: Time Clock Report: View

docs.text: As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing empty container report or generate it. To download for the container with status as complete The page is divided into separate section which includes the selection section and the associated filtered results The first includes the selection of building through the following Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button Generate & generate summary button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) View button would redirect to the detail page Buttons will be activate once you select the desired row on tab Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report Select customer by entering the name, related information will appear in the dropdown. select the desired from the dropdown Select desired state & city Select the desired building from the dropdown. Buildings appear based on the above filters applied Select the desired shift & departments Select the date range (start & end) from the calendar pop up By default, the current date appears Start & End date can be same As per the selected filters, information starts to appear in the next section which is again divided into three tabs. If no information is available, no records found message appears First Tab - Select Building - All available shifts & departments will appear The following columns appear Customer - Name of the customer will appear Building - building name will appear Shift - shift name will appear Department - department name will appear Leads - Lead name will appear You can either select any particular row or can select all Second Tab - select shift / department - Can select specific shift or departments for buildings The following columns appear Customer - Name of the customer will appear Building - building name will appear Shift - shift name will appear Department - department name will appear Leads - Lead name will appear You can either select any particular row or can select all Third Tab - Find Container - Shows the employee information who have worked on the containers The following columns appear Date - The date on which the container was marked as completed. Follows the format as year, month, date Customer - Name of the customer will appear Building - building name will appear Shift - shift name will appear Department - department name will appear Leads - Name of the lead will appear Container - container details entered for the completed container will appear You can either select any particular row or can select all Hierarchy Order in listing is as followed Shift - Day, Swing, Night Department - Operations, Receiving, Shipping
docs.title: Empty Container Report: Item Selection

docs.text: The page is divided into separate section which includes the building details with ready to export functionality and for the container type details The first section - Building details consists of Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button Generate button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report Building details which includes Building Name - with the complete address Customer Name Shift - Shift of the building Manager - Name of the manager Department - full name of the department appears Supervisor - Name of the supervisor Reports Date Range - The selected date range will appear in month, date & year format The next section includes the empty container title with count type for containers with complete status. The following column appears. Date - full date available with day, month, date & year Door - Information added by lead for entering container parameters Container - Information added by lead for entering container parameters Time Emptied - When the container was given a complete status Hierarchy order for listing is Date (chronological order) Time Emptied (alphabetical order ) Door (alphabetical order, number order) Container# (alphabetical order, number order) "
docs.title: Empty Containers Report: View

docs.text: As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing customer lists item selection or generate it. The page is divided into separate section which includes the selection section and the associated filtered results The first includes the selection of building through the following Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button Generate & generate summary button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) Buttons will be activate once you select the desired row on tab Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report Select desired state & city Able to filter the list by dates the date range (start & end) from the calendar pop up By default, All dates radio button is selected Can select year Can select the custom date range (start & end) from the calendar pop up By default, the current date appears Start & End date can be same As per the selected filters, information starts to appear in the next section which is again divided into two tabs. If no information is available, no records found message appears First Tab - Active - All active customers will appear The following columns appear Customer - Name of the customer will appear Building - count of the building Managers - count of the manager Supervisor - count of the supervisor Active Since - date the customer profile is active since You can either select any particular row or can select all Second Tab - Non Active - All non active employees will appear The following columns appear Customer - Name of the customer will appear Building - count of the building Managers - count of the manager Supervisor - count of the supervisor Non Active Since - date the customer profile was made non active You can either select any particular row or can select all
docs.title: Customer List: Item Selection

docs.text: As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as viewing employees lists item selection or generate it. The page is divided into separate section which includes the selection section and the associated filtered results The first includes the selection of building through the following Radio buttons for PDF & excel button with generate & generate all button Generate & generate summary button would automatically download the selected format (pdf or excel) Buttons will be activate once you select the desired row on tab Generate All button appears when there are multiple pages in a report Customer - Name of the customer will appear Building - building name will appear Role - All roles of the employee will appear and can select from the dropdown Select desired state & city Able to filter the list by dates the date range (start & end) from the calendar pop up By default, All dates radio button is selected Can select year Can select the custom date range (start & end) from the calendar pop up By default, the current date appears Start & End date can be same As per the selected filters, information starts to appear in the next section which is again divided into two tabs. If no information is available, no records found message appears First Tab - Active - All active employees will appear with the total count in header The following columns appear Name - name of the employee will appear ID - Unique ID associated with employee will appear Phone - Unique phone number associated with employee will appear Email - Unique email associated with employee will appear Role - Role of the employee appears Work Location - The address sof the building employee is assigned to appears Active Since - date the customer profile is active since You can either select any particular row or can select all Second Tab - Non Active - All non active employees will appear with the total count in header The following columns appear Name - name of the employee will appear ID - Unique ID associated with employee will appear Phone - Unique phone number associated with employee will appear Email - Unique email associated with employee will appear Role - Role of the employee appears Work Location - The address sof the building employee is assigned to appears Non Active Since - date the customer profile was made non active You can either select any particular row or can select all
docs.title: Employees List: Item Selection

docs.text: When there are no lead and lumpers scheduled as temporary for a building only for the building the DM is assigned to. The information in table appears as blank with no records as seen in the image. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as adding, cancelling or unassign a lumper Search - search bars which throws result for the below two functions. All Buildings As you type the respective associated information regarding the entered building name will start appearing in the table. If no data is available then no records will be shown Search function overwrites the filters. Search Lumper, Lead Search through the name of lead and lumpers that are temporarily scheduled, results will start populating in the table If no information is available, then no records will be shown Widgets Shift - Can select the shifts from the dropdown District Managers - Name of the person who has created the schedule appears in the dropdown Department - can select departments from the dropdown All Dates - Can search via specific schedule through their work date Two types of section are available; Scheduled and expired Schedules with the count. Schedules are the ones which are active and running for the current and upcoming days. Expired are the ones where the schedule was cancelled or the work date has been passed. Table for each section include the same columns as follows Temp lumpers - Name of the employee(lead & Lumper) Sent to Building - For whom the employee is scheduled for District Manager - Name of the main district manager of the scheduled building Lead- Name of the main lead of the scheduled building Shift Details - Building's shift details appear Assigned By - Name of the person who assigned Date Assigned - When the employee was added as temporary Work date - For the day, teh lumper is assigned Start Time - From when the schedule lumper will start Status - Various types of following status appears for the scheduled Scheduled - When the schedule has been created and work has not started. Cancelled - When the temporary lumper request has been cancelled by admin or DM. Completed - When the scheduled work for the temporary lumper has been completed. Action Notes - As you click on the button, a pop up open to view the details of the scheduled notes. Button would be disabled when no notes have been added and grey when there are notes Edit - Edit button to edit the schedule details Cancel - Blue cross button to cancel the schedule. The assigned temporary employee will be unassigned
docs.title: Landing Page

docs.text: To add a lead or lumper on temporary basis only for the building the DM is assigned to, a pop up opens when you click on the add button. The fields are as follows: Customer Start typing the customer name, relevant names would appear in the dropdown and can select from the dropdown. Search will start appearing once you enter the first alphabet Building Respective building under the customer name wills start appearing Shift - The selected shift for the building will start appearing Department - The selected department will start appearing for the selected building Select lumpers Available lead & lumpers will start appearing proven they fulfil the criteria that they have the ability to travel selected as yes Distance to be shown, calculating them from selected employee address to selected building address; if it falls under their mentioned range of travel across buildings have them appear in the dropdown Not assigned as the main lead & lumper for the building For the same building and shift can assign the same employee Can search the employee by entering their name Work Duration - Based on custom, weekly, day or monthly Start time - Only shows the range selected for the building Notes - Enter the notes for the temporary schedule lumper Schedule button remains deactivated until all information is fulfilled, with a success notification it redirects you back to the listing page. All are mandatory field except notes
docs.title: Add Temporary Lumper

docs.text: When a lead requests for lumper, the requests appear on the web portal under lumper requests only for the building the DM is assigned to. As the new request has been made, a red count appear in the side navigating tab and a rot dot appears beside the new lumper request on it's landing page. When there are no lead and lumpers scheduled as temporary for a building. The information in table appears as blank with no records as seen in the image. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as to fulfil a request partially or fully. Search - search bars which throws result for the below two functions. All Buildings As you type the respective associated information regarding the entered building name will start appearing in the table. If no data is available then no records will be shown Search function overwrites the filters. Customer Search through the name of Customer for whom the request is generated, results will start populating in the table If no information is available, then no records will be shown Search Customer, building District manager, Lead Search through the name of Customer, building District manager and lead for whom the request is generated, results will start populating in the table If no information is available, then no records will be shown Widgets Select state & city Status Pending - When the request hasn't been fulfilled Complete - When the request has been fulfilled Partial - When the request has been partially fulfilled Rejected - when the request has been denied Expired - When the request start time, date has been passed Two types of section are available; Active and Non Active Request with the count. Active Requests are the ones for which requests are pending or currently running and for upcoming days. Non Active requests are the ones where the request ahs not been fullfiled as it date has been passed or was denied. Table for each section include the same columns as follows Building - For whom the employee is scheduled for District Manager - Name of the main district manager of the scheduled building Lead- Name of the main lead of the scheduled building Shift Details - Building's shift details appear Request Made - When was the request made with the day, date and time information Work date - For the day, the lumper is requested for, with the days remaining from the current day Lumpers Start Time - From when the schedule lumper will start working Lumper Assigned - The number of requests that were made, how many were approved or not Can click on the number, a pop up opens where you can vie all the lumpers assigned Can click on the red button under unassigned for the lumpers Clicking on the button, the assigned lumper will be unassigned Status - Various types of following status appears for the scheduled Pending - When there is no action on the request Complete - When the request has been fulfilled Partial - When the request has been partially fulfilled Rejected - when the request has been denied Expired - When the request start time, date has been passed Action Notes - As you click on the button, a pop up open to view the details of the scheduled notes. Button would be disabled when no notes have been added and grey when there are notes Check button - To approve the request As you click on the button, the Available lead & lumpers will start appearing proven they fulfil the criteria have the ability to travel selected as yes Distance to be shown, calculating them from selected employee address to selected building address; if it falls under their mentioned range of travel across buildings have them appear in the dropdown Not assigned as the main lead & lumper for the building For the same building and shift can assign the same employee Can search the employee by entering their name Cancel - Blue button to deny the request. The assigned employee will be unassigned. Clicking on yes, would reject the request.
docs.title: Lumper Request

docs.text: When a requests for corrections is made through lead only for the building the DM is assigned to, the requests appear on the web portal under correction requests. As the new request has been made, a red count appear in the side navigating tab and a rot dot appears beside the new correction request on it's landing page. When there are no correction requests submitted by the lead. "Message when there is no information to display is based on status; For no [Pending Corrections, Corrections Made, Corrections Denied]. The information in table appears as blank with no records as seen in the image. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page such as to make a correction. Below are the widgets & landing page information as it appears on the landing page Search - search bars which throws result for the below two functions. Customer Search through the name of Customer for whom the request is generated, results will start populating in the table If no information is available, then no records will be shown Search District manager, Lead, Correction For Search through the name building's District manager and lead for whom the request is generated, results will start populating in the table If no information is available, then no records will be shown TThe hierarchy followed for information in listing is Work Date - chronological order Customer - alphabetical order Building - alphabetical order Shift - Day, Swing, Night Department - Operations, Receiving, Shipping Lead - alphabetical order Correction for - alphabetical order The page is divided based on their status into three sections which are as followed and shown in the image with following columns for all. Work date - when the work has been completed by lead on the container. Used abbreviated month name Second column changes based on status Pending correction: Request Made- When the request has been made by lead Corrections Made: Approved On - When the correction were submitted Correction Denied: Not Approved On - When the correction request was denied Customer - Customer name Building - Building Name Shift - Shift of the building Department - Department of the building District Manager - Name of the DM assigned to building Lead - Assigned main lead name comes on the page Correction For - By whom the request has been submitted by Issue - container type appears Status Pending - When the request has been initiated Updated - After after making the desired correction for a request and are submitted Rejected - when the admin or DM denies the correction request Cancelled by lead - wen request has been canceled through lead Action Note Lead correction note pop up opens up which shows the information of the lead such as its container parameters & time clock information Split container button when clicked shows information about the employees who have worked on the container Profile Card Opens a pop up for viewing the contact's information Edit redirects you to make correction page Only available for pending requests Deny A confirmation pop up opens, once you click on yes, a success message appears & redirects you to the listing page. Only available for pending requests Pending Correction: with the count of pending requests for whom no action is taken. When lead requests for correction, it comes under this section Request in 'Correction Made' and 'Correction Denied' tables should display for 14 days from when request was approved/denied. Correction Made: with the count of requests for whom action is taken & submitted. When admin or DM makes the desired correction as stated by lead, then after submission requests move to this section. Once clicked on the edit button, redirect us to the make correction page. As you click on the 'i' button beside the title, a informative pop up opens which gives a snippet of the page on how to make a correction. In the first section building info appears with building name, address & associated main lead, customer and its contacts name, shift & shift timings and work date. Only the contacts that have a permission for the corresponding building appears In the second section employee information appears with the name, employee and signature in the title of the table followed by columnar information of status, Type, Container Parameters and notes for customer In the third section, information entered by the lead while creating a request is shown All container parameters and notes saved for customer can be edited. Has the correction been approved by customer pop up opens Once you click on yes for above pop up, another pop up opens to make the correction. Action made on this page reflect on the portal under pending status once you leave or discard the changes by not submitting the changes Submit button stays disable until changes are made. The changes are reflected to lead, admin & DM once they are submitted. Then the requests is move to corrections made section Denied Corrections: with the count of requests which were denied by Admin or DM. Lead gets an email notification after a correction request is approved or denied. From: QHL Support Subject: Correction Request Update Hi [Lead's First Name], Your correction request was Approved. DETAILS Work Date: Thursday, May 6, 2021 Container: Outbound; abcdekmlm 1 (this is container type & #) If approve show all corrections made: CORRECTIONS Container Number: Before: abcdek222 M Correction: abcdekmlm 1 Cases: Before: 1000 Correction: 2222 Reminder: Please ensure lumper's Work Done is updated as well. (This message appears only when cases is edited) Weight: Before: 52 Correction: 30 Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics If the correction request is not approved, the following email notification is shared From: QHL Support Subject: Correction Request Update Hi [Lead's First Name], Your correction request was Not Approved. What is the Correction? Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Please contact your DM if you have any questions or concerns. Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics
docs.title: Landing page

docs.text: Lead Onboarding Sign In Quickhands Logistics logo will appear on the top with the illustration image. Cursor is placed on the employee ID field by default, placeholder would be in grey color for the fields. Enter the valid employee ID and password(can click on the eye icon to show & hide the entered password) and click on sign in, you'll be logged into the application If both the fields are left blank, will throw a validation message "Please enter Employee Id" If the employee ID or password field is left blank and clicked on sign in, will throw a validation error message as "Please enter Employee Id" and "Please enter Password" respectively If wrong employee ID or password is entered, will throw the notification as "Invalid employee ID or password" Forgot Password As you click on the forgot password button, will redirect you the screen to enter the employee ID in order to receive the reset password email. Quickhands Logistics logo will appear on the top with the illustration image. Following text appears above the employee ID field "Enter the following information to receive an email with a link to reset your password." Reset Password button is activated before the employee ID is entered. If you leave the field blank and click on the reset password button, will throw a error message as "Please enter Employee Id" When you enter the wrong, correct employee ID and click on the button, will show the success message in the pop up as "Reset Password link has been sent.Please check your email" Once you click on the ok button, will redirect you to the sign in page. Reset Password Below is the email template with the link to reset your password From: QHL Support Subject: Reset Password Hi [user's first name], Please use the link below to reset the password for your account. Click here to reset your password *Link access will expire in 48 hours. Thanks Quick Hands Logistics The link is valid for 48 hours Password should follow the format of minimum 8 characters that includes 1 Uppercase, 1 Lowercase, 1 Special Character, 1 Number, else will throw a validation message Reset button will be disable until the information is entered Will throw a validation error message if the passwords do not match If click on cancel button, will redirect you back to the sign in page To show the field is active and cursor is placed on the field, placeholder would be in blue color, otherwise in grey color. As you click on reset button, will throw a success notification "Password has been updated" and redirect you to the screen. Below is the template user receives when they set their password From: QHL Support Subject: Password Updated Hi [user's first name], Your password has been successfully updated! (link to home page of sing-in page here) Thanks, Quick Hands Logistics" Logout A confirmation pop up opens when you click on the logout from side navigating tab. As you select yes, the employee will be redirected to sign in screen. As you select no, employee will be redirected to the screen he was present at. User Profile As you cliCk on the arrow on the top beside the logged in person name, you'll be redirected to the profile details QHL LOgo will appear on the top with the cubic images Profile image will appear if the lead has uploaded, if not then the default image will appear Name of the lead appears Role with the associated building name appears in the second line In 4 different card section, the lead information appears First section is Contact which includes phone number and email of the lead Second section is Work Identification which includes employee ID, role, title(if there is no information "---" will appear) and Department Third section is Work Schedule which includes the availability, shift, shift hours and schedule notes(if there is no information "---" will appear) Fourth section is Work Location which includes the customer and building name Through the back button beside the title name, user can revert to previously selected section Work Sheet This section appears for the current today's date to show the scheduled work if any, to add any container and take action on the scheduled container Landing Page Title appears on the top as Worksheet with the three menu buttons on right. Building details appears below the title which includes building name, complete today's date with buildings shift, department. Total container scheduled for today appears with count and customer notes if saved any while creating a schedule. When no containers are scheduled then blank page appears as shown in image. Once the container have been scheduled either by customer's contact or lead, they start coming in the listing with status in various tabs. Each container card can be clicked and redirects you to the container detail page which are explained further in detail Ongoing - When the containers are scheduled, they appear under this status with the total count of container Complete - When the work done on the container is completed, they appear under this status with the total count of containers Cancel - When the container have been cancelled by lead or contact, they appear under this status with the total count of containers Unfinished - When the work done on the container is not complete and partially done, they appear under this status with the total count of containers Not Open - When the container have been given not open, they appear under this status with the total count of containers Add Container When there are no schedules then the lead can create one by adding the containers. When the schedule is already created, lead can add more containers which will be creating a new schedule on the admin & customer portal. Mandatory to add time for containers Add button remains disable until at least one container haven't been scheduled with quantity & date Once you select on '+' icon, section expands to enter quantity & time Can click on blue cross icon from expanded layout to remove the particular container Can enter schedules notes if any and not a mandatory field Once the container has been added, a informative pop up opens with the information about what is being added which includes count with container type aith the time Clicking on cancel would revert to the add container section By clicking on back button, a pop up opens to discard the information & leave. Today's Work Cancel After 'Save' button is pressed on 'Today's Work is Cancel' page - the status on all schedules containers changes to cancel. - all containers (with cancel status) should move to the Cancel (tab) screen. - Notes added in 'Today's Work is Cancel' should appear as Group Notes in the cancel (tab) screen Container Detail Parameters Tab Edit Parameters Lumpers Add Lumpers Notes Time Clock This section serves as way to record reporting time of employees. By default the assigned main lead card appears. All the employee who are have clocked in to work upon the container appears below which includes, assigned main lead & lumper, requested & temporary lead & lumper. The red color ring appears for temporary lumper and purple color ring for requested lumpers. Landing page Title appears on the top as Time Clock with the current day and date. In the next section a horizontal scrollable calendar appears with the day & date By default, current date is selected. Previous Date appears in orange when the clock in information is saved for that day but clocked out isn't Previous date appears in bold when the the clock in & clock out information is saved for the date By default, lead card appears to add the reporting time information When multiple employees are scheduled, they will appear one below the other Card Information includes; Lead Name, employee ID and the clocked & lunch timings with the profile image. Can add notes Each card has a checkbox beside the name to individually or together to enter time. Add Time By clicking on the add time button, a pop up appears to add the time by clicking on respective buttons Customer Sheet When there are no containers with scheduled status and all have been given their respective status then the customer sheet has to be signed. Landing Page Title appears as customer sheet with building name below it. A calendar box to pick the desired date for viewing the customer sheet Cannot select future dates Before the details of customer sheet appears, total containers count appears above that section A signature button appears to sign the sheet Remains non clickable when there are no containers that have moved from ongoing to any other state Customer sheet section includes the following details when there is no work done a shown in the image Customer sheet section consists of the logo, title & building details (name & address) The date Since today's date is selected by default then the current date appears When the previous dates are selected, the date changes with respective to filter applied Shift & department appears All the status with count of container appears; when there is work done for the container and moved under this status After the sheet has been signed, customer section appears with the signature, saved representative name and notes signed button is disable once the customer sheet has been signed Lumper Sheet Once the employee is scheduled to work on the container, their information appears on this section.
